text: Unorganized! Terrible terrible service. Toddlers could have done a better job. They don't even have enough plates to serve the people at the tables. Been sitting at my table for over 30 min and they havent taken our order and we haven't even gotten drinks. Soy container is filthy with dust and wasabi is old. Never coming back here again.
Best restaurant ever! If you love sushi you will love this roll! Friendly staffcan't get enough! Must check out

This is the first time trying this place, and it was pretty disappointing. When we first parked outside, 5 staff members were standing there and on their phones playing Pokémon (there was a lure set inside lol) and one of them says "you're the first customers we've had in hours!" 

.....I don't wanna hear that as we come inside. And the guy taking our order didn't know much about the food and told us "the server is talking to the manager, I'm just the guy in the back of the house who makes the sauces..." But when we asked him for Screaming O sauce (or orgasm sauce) he didn't know what that was, even though it's in some of their rolls... 

The server (when she finally came to us) got parts of our order wrong multiple times and we had to repeat ourselves and correct her. Edamame came out way after our other food. Server took forever to come take another order for us, and our 1 hour time limit for Deluxe Menu (for $32.99!!!) was almost up. We could have ordered more for food and had a better experience, but the service was definitely not on par. 

Also, when some of the workers' friends walked in the door, one of the sushi chefs yells "okay now that this guy walked in, everyone can leave now! Everyone out!" Like, okay...that's not professional and makes this place look bad. Sorry, but it does.

Last roll that we ordered had taken way too long to order, and when I mentioned something to the server, she said "they're still making the order." Then she comes back and says "wait, what did you order again?" I said "I don't want it anymore, it's okay." And she said "no I was looking for your ticket...what did you get?" And my friend said the name of the roll...and then 30 seconds later she said their almost done with it. Yeah...okay...we couldn't even finish it because it took too long to come out. That sucks.

Food was okay, maybe 3/5 stars, but service was not there 1/5.

Great sushi, friendly staff & free saki with our Yelp check-in! We don't often have the all you can eat sushi but we tried it and were pleasantly surprised, and our hunger satiated.  Ann was very helpful with our order and the sushi chefs were having fun singing to the cool 80's techno music. Nice, casual place to go for lunch or dinner. Give it a try!

LOVE this place!  They have a Jenny-Roll, which I like to say is named after myself :)  It's delicious!  They also have one called the Sticky-Icky Roll which I'm not sure is still on the menu-but they'll make it if you ask.  It has coconut and peanut butter.  SOOOO good!

I'm updating my old review because this place has made a ton of improvements over the last year. The food is consistently good, service is friendly and fast, and the AYCE is a good value. This has become my "go to" sushi place.

My friend and myself recently tried this place out and were absolutely blown away by the whole staffs attentiveness and they went out of their way to cater to our dietary needs( gluten free).   The food was amazing too.  We did the all you can eat menu.  The fish tasted fresh, the rolls were tasty, and the staff was extremely pleasant.  If you're looking for a great neighborhood sushi spot, you gotta check this place out!!!! I will be back!!!!

If you're looking for a place where you can walk in, sit at the bar and scarf down 2 big rolls and 12-16 sashimi in 15 minutes, this is the place!  I bring a diet soda in, I know that's not really good sushi "Etiquette."  But for me, I like to keep the sushi budget low, if I can make it once a week. This place only runs me $21 a week, with tip. $16.20 for all you can eat, lunch, without a drink and a $5 bill in the tip jar on the way out!  I love this routine...  It's so nice.  You get to a point where you enjoy what you eat because the price is so low for lunch, which cuts off at 4:00 pm, that you stop worrying about gorging yourself to get your "Money's Worth."  Some places are great cause they have some special items on the menu and I will go back to them once or twice a year maybe.  But for a Sushi place that's like Fast Food but NOT Fast Food quality this is my favorite right now.

I like this place for a fast lunch, and they have all you can eat lunch and dinner which is a plus! I've only had less than satisfying service here once but it seemed like they were short staffed that day and there was a lunch rush all at once. People have bad days sow time, I get it. The fish is always fresh and I usually leave satisfied and full of yummy fish! It's clean and quiet and I didn't feel like I was being timed/watched like I have at other all you can eat sushi establishments. Will be returning.
Great prices on above average sushi and service. Try the mortal combat roll as a part of your $15 all u can eat lunch.

I was in the mood for sushi and this place was right down the street from where I live. For $19.95 all you can eat - I though it wouldn't be too bad.

The service was mediocre. Waitress was uncommunicative and kept calling management over when we had simple questions. 

The food was terrible. Artificial ground up crab. Too much rice. Really weird sushi rolls. Bizarre sauces. Bacon bits? Seriously!! Not authentic in the slightest and they fish was not fresh at all. 

We kept getting food delivered to us that we didn't order. 

Finally, when we were done attempting to eat what we had ordered, we had approximately half of one roll, and one or two pieces from a two other rolls left. When our waitress came we asked if we could take the food home (I am never one who likes to leave food on my plate even if I don't intend to eat it. Don't want to be rude). Her response: 

No. You must eat everything you order or they charge the AYCE fee plus the individual charges for the individual rolls. And you can't take anything home with you. Theses weren't even half rolls!! One piece left and they would charge us for the whole roll! The waitress did not inform us of this policy when we EXPLICITLY asked her when we sat down!!! I was infuriated. 

We finished what we could of the disgusting rolls until practically vomiting and then were charged $19.95 plus an additional $15 for two pieces left of one roll. 

It was the most unpleasant experience of my sushi eating life. 

Will never, ever eat here again.

Just awful. The sushi is bad and the customer service even worse. The waitress didn't even know what items were on the menu!! We ended up getting charged for an extra appetizer that we never even ordered. With so many great sushi places in las Vegas, you can definitely spend your money more wisely elsewhere.

AYCE is pretty cheap and you're paying for what you get and possibly more. I really enjoyed the vibe from the restaurant and the employees. The environment of the restaurant is really chill. It's a place where you can really enjoy good food and company.

Amazing service, amazing sushi!

We came here for lunch to see our favorite server, Courtney, and we absolutely loved it. 
She recommended our new favorites: Tuna Carpaccio, the Sticky Icky roll, and the ultimate Taylor Swift roll. Spend the extra money and go for the Deluxe AYCE, you won't regret it!!! Another plus is there awesome music selection. 

Thanks for the awesome experience-
You know we'll be back!

Pros: The sushi chefs are very pleasant, the fish is very fresh, appetizers and rolls taste pretty good, and it's an affordable lunch price of $14.99 which comes to $16 something with tax. 

Cons: The waitress is wildly unpleasant and watches over everyone like a hawk. They get orders mixed up very easily, even when the restaurant isn't packed, and they aim to make you eat as little as possible. The latter really cheapens the place.

I normally frequent Sushi Twister, but I was nowhere near that side of town when I had my sushi craving so I looked up sushi reviews and figured I would give this place a try because it was less than a mile away. I should have trusted the people who made more recent reviews on several websites. I had kept reading reviews where people would complain that the service isn't what it used to be and that the rolls are 90% rice and have gone down in quality. Much to my dismay, this is ALL true. 

I went in solo, sat at the bar. Right off the bat I realize that this place advertises free wifi, but they do NOT have wifi that you can tap into. I order the baked dynamite scallop appetizer and the mussels appetizer and my first roll to try was the Downtown roll. I was brought a two-piece scallop sushi roll. That was it. I was like "Uh, no. I ordered the scallop APPETIZER." so they took it back and I waited several minutes before I got anything else. 

The next thing they brought me was the Downtown roll. Which I noticed immediately weighs like fourteen pounds. I told myself "Okay, maybe they just go heavy with the salmon on this roll." I tried it, it was pretty great. But the roll was so heavy that I had trouble getting through it. (The lunch is AYCE so I was annoyed that I was already getting full). Next they brought out the dynamite scallops. Which were piping hot and very fresh and had really flavorful mushrooms and cheese in it. Loved it. I waited for my order of mussels and it never came. Next roll I ordered was the Lisa Lisa. I ordered it because it was a five piece roll and I wanted to try at least three or four rolls while there. 

The Lisa Lisa arrived and I was immediately annoyed. It was huge. It was heavy. Yes, it was tasty. BUT. They put sooo much extra rice in the roll. It was completely ridiculous. After that five piece roll I was bordering on full and knew that I shouldn't push it and order a third roll because you PAY for what you DON'T finish eating. I was still annoyed they never brought my mussels so I glanced up behind the bar and noticed one of the workers grabbing an order of already-done mussels and tossing it in the trash. Because it had been sitting for too long. So that answers where my order of mussels were. They made it in the back and then the workers up front never brought it out to me. I ordered a fresh batch and it was brought out to me in about another ten minutes. It was very fresh and very tasty but by that point I was too annoyed for words to fully enjoy it. 

So, there you have it. If you decide to go to this restaurant, know that they use MASS amounts of sticky rice to fill you up so you'll order less food. That's tacky and has pissed me off to the point where I had to make sure I post this review on as many sites as possible. Legitimate sushi restaurants lets the FISH speak for itself and don't need to drown their rolls in rice. Expect unpleasant waitresses. I left her a tip of $3 and she didn't even deserve that much. Very displeased with this restaurant. Nobody can measure up to Sushi Twister!

Excellent food! Excellent prices! Server was very friendly even though she was swamped on the floor, she remained calm under pressure. Came for the all you can eat and boy did we get the all you can eat.

Once upon a time I would have given this place 5 stars for their great price and quality. Most of their rolls are fried and fill you up really fast, but they are interesting and pretty good. Side dishes are also good, especially the tuna ones that are presented like flavored sashimi. Not true sashimi since its been tainted with flavors, but still good. 

This past trip was our third visit and the yellow tail that we usually get a lot of wasn't very fresh, so they tried to drizzle their vinegar/soy sauce over it to mask the taste. 

The cuts of fish were very small and the amount of rice seemed to get bigger with each round orders. 

Most of these changes are likely due to the change in management, but for $15 all you can eat for lunch it is all right. Not great good anymore, but decent good. My opinion might also be a bit of a sushi snob since I've eaten so much of it from everywhere. If I can wait then I'd rather just have sushi in Reno for a similar price when I go back to visit.

I live across town so would never drive way up here for a place I've never heard of, but a friend told us about the $15 AYCE dinner special going on at the moment. So we tried it. Won't ever be back. Just because you are having a special doesn't mean you drop the quality of food. Nothing was fresh except for the salty ass teriyaki chicken (came with some cold rice too). The cooked rolls tasted like they were made in the morning and left out all day. I love the 2 piece raw sushi rolls but the ones here made me gag and had undone rice. The server didn't know much and her favorite word was "uh". Anything on the AYCE menu they don't want to give you for the $15 special will simply be "all out today". I don't mind the dessert not being included, but I wish they'd be honest about the other items not being included rather than saying they're all out. We figured this out when we ordered the seafood sashimi salad and was told they were all out but could order salmon, tuna, etc.
I ALMOST feel bad leaving this negative review due to only having one server for a full restaurant, but I strongly feel if you run a special that you should offer the same quality and have just as many people working to make sure these new customers keep coming back rather than leaving you a negative review.
Food was mediocre and it took 30-45minutes just for our first order of food to come out. Not worth

This place is getting a five star review from me, because it is one of the most memorable dining experiences I have ever had. I was laughing at everything going on! One waiter for about 50 diners who turns out to be the cook that quit 2 weeks ago... we got little to no service... they offered a dream deal of $10 a person all you can eat sushi for lunch.... except we got no food... well maybe that is an exaggeration.... but all else can't be exaggerated enough... my stomach hurts not from over eating, but from laughing so hard at this crazy operation.... if you can tolerate this insanity and turn it into a comedy showcase then this is the best family fun you will ever have at restaurant!!!! Food that did arrive eventually was good....
Another great meal. Fish is fresh and service is great. Sodas come in huge glasses. Great vibe. Great AYE price. Well worth it!

I love this place it's always so good and everyone's is so friendly all the time 
They always bring out the food quick
Just came back after being away for a couple months. New staff, new chef, new menu! All good. Place was packed in no time. Great deal on AYCE! Will not take so long to come back again!
Oh my gosh I completely love being here for the all you can eat and all-you-can-drink this is the best sushi restaurant in  area ever! Chef Steven and Philip and Mike the servers are awesome!

This place is absolutely terrible. For starters, when we got there we ordered waters. She came to our table 3 times after and still no waters. Then, she got an extremely simple order wrong. (Order 3 orders of eel because there was 3 us) she brought out one order. She never gave us chopsticks, napkins or plates and didn't ask if we needed anything else after she dropped off that one order. The sushi chefs looked very unprofessional and were rude. Of the 5 tables she had at the time, 2 of them left included ourselves. The sushi did not look fresh, nor did it smell fresh. The over al experience was terrible and I would NEVER return to this place. Please if you ever come here save yourself the trouble and find some where else. The server was also rude to as we left, but I held my tongue and kindly told we were going to take our services elsewhere.  I wish I could give no stars because they do not deserve even one. The only positive thing about this place is there is a pokestop next to it

One star because there is no way for me to review with zero stars. We have been going to this restaurant for 2 years, and have never had a problem. Last night we ordered food to go. My 7 year old daughter asked for a California roll. We also ordered a Mexican roll, tiger roll, and spicy tuna roll. I got home about an hour and a half after the order was made.  The spicy tuna was a little fishy, but I figured it was because it was because it was in the fridge for an hour and a half. My daughter ate most of the California roll, and my sister and boyfriend had what she left. This evening, approximately 26 hours after eating the roll, my daughter started crying and complaining of a stomach ache (which she never does).  She then threw up seaweed and cucumber all over herself. I called the restaurant and the guy who answered was completely indifferent, but said he would pass my concern along to a manager, as there was no one there to take my call. A guy named Steve called me back and said they take these calls very seriously and suggested I take her to the doctor or emergency room. I told him I would keep an eye on her and take her in the morning if the symptoms didn't subside, but that I was concerned because all parties who ate the California roll were feeling ill, so I thought it may be the crab. He said they make five liters of crab at a time, and that they just got inspected by the health department and got an A grade. As I was on the phone with him, she started throwing up again. I called him back, and let him know that they could expect a bill from me if I indeed had to take her to the ER.  He then said that the experience was unfortunate, but that they are not liable!  Unreal!  Thanks for your concern, STEVE!  Do NOT waste your money at this  cesspool!

Hands Down, best sushi in town. To defend and clarify: Yama sushi on Flamingo, and Osaka on Sahara, formerly my favorite places, come close but not as good. Tokyo Sushi is where I'll be going for quality fish and unique tastes. Recommendations: Jessica albacore, garlic yellowtail jalapeño, tuna carpaccio. If you want unique and sweet: sticky icky (has peanut butter), and hello kitty roll. Try the rock shrimp aioli and the creamy shrimp appetizers.

I saw some bad comments but I satisfied today. I had good food and friendly service. The chef was very friendly and polite!
I'll try Deluxe next time!
One waiter and two cooks. Slow service, had rolls come out 20 minutes late. Got crowded quick too so service was even slower.

Went for a recent dinner expecting to have just one, maybe 2 rolls. Was told by the hostess that the all-u-can-eat for dinner is now only $20!? Incredible!

  Easily the best sushi value in Vegas, the quality of fish didn't disappoint either.  Salmon and tuna were standouts. Red rock roll is bomb.
 
 For lunch the ayce is only $14.99, prepare to grub!

Wow, we had ayce sushi last night and every roll was awesome! The Mexican roll is my personal favorite but truly every roll was great! Cucumber salad, tempura shrimp and veggies, Mochi for dessert, all fresh and full of flavor! Attention to detail and great service- they earned the stars!

Came here last night for a family get together. My girlfriend's stepmother recommended we try this place, so 5 of us came in. We all did AYCE sushi (non-deluxe, no alcohol included). The food itself was decent, about what you'd expect from any run of the mill sushi place. A few above average rolls, but mostly average. The prices were more than our favorite local sushi places, but the options were worse, less of them, and lower quality.

The real problem though was the service. We ordered rolls about three times, and each time it took upwards of 20 minutes, in 1 case over a half hour to receive our food. And even little things like getting drink refills and bringing more wasabi/soy sauce took much longer than they should have. They either need more staff or better staff.

The two sushi chefs which are in plain view of the whole restaurant were clearly disorganized and/or had other priorities. Not only did I see people who came in well after us get serviced quicker, but I also saw them doing shots and chatting up friends of theirs at the bar rather than making rolls for everyone. In one case one was doing shots and wiping his mouth with his gloved hand, and continuing to work without washing or changing gloves!

My boyfriend and I love this sushi spot. They have a great selection of sushi rolls. The prices for AYCE are great, and the whole staff is very friendly. We love going to Tokyo sushi.  If you want sushi at a great price Tokyo sushi house is the place.

We wanted to try a new sushi place outside of China town. We were referred to this place and thought it would be good. We were seated at 550pm asked for drinks, waited 10 mins for drinks and had to ask for straws which we got 10 mins later, our sushi nigiri plate arrived at 620pm after asking if we could at least get the edame and spam musubi that we ordered with the sushi. The next plate and roll came with the edamame at 645pm. Never got the spam musubi even after asking for it. Had to stand up and ask the bar for Wasabi as we couldn't get service. Stopped waitress on her way to back to get ice cream at about 7 10pm and ask for refill on water. Didn't get the water because she asked if we still wanted the water when she brought my closed check.to me. I was still hungry when we left close to 730pm. Didn't want to order more because the wait time was sooo long. Not worth the drive and the price.

One of the better sushi places I have been to.  Great food.  Great staff.  Great price.  I recommend the Korean BBQ roll (It is like surf and turf on a roll) and the sticky icky roll (taste like peanut butter & jelly).  What a great place!  Oh ya they also do 1/2 rolls so you can try all their good stuff.

This is my Sushi spot. Always fresh, always clean & always friendly. And they have the best 'all you can eat' price. $14.99 lunch & 19.99 for dinner. That is an unbelievably amazing price. I've eaten here at least twice a month for the past 2 years and I've NEVER received any bad service, nor bad sushi

I stopped here for lunch with hopes of having a nice sushi lunch but was severely disappointed. Our waiter was very scattered and the sushi chefs were overwhelmed with orders. The menus were dirty. The sauce bottles were dirty. The sushi bar was dirty. The sushi chefs were very nice and made decent rolls. If they cleaned up and got better servers I would return, maybe. The worst thing, and what really concerns me, is that my dining companion got sick. We ate the same meal except he got sick from the rock shrimp aoli which I did not eat. Be cautious

Worst sushi experience ever!! They charge half AYCE price for 2yr old. (According to their house rule, anyone can seat without a highchair is charged. ) Food came out too slowly, we spent more time waiting for food. Their fishes were not fresh at all. Their chicken teriyaki bento has about 10 tiny tiny pieces of chicken mixed with all kinds of chopped vegies. Also, they were out of Sapporo. The server was awful(when I had a question about the bill, she said "you got a problem??"). Never smile, Never ask food was OK, Didn't even provide silverware for a kid they charge half  AYCE.  I like AYCE, but not this place. Won't go again even if it's free.
Bad quality service at least when I went. There was slow service, the waiter was rude and forgot most of our orders.

For those of you giving this place 4 or 5 stars you probably just came to this place recently. I've been coming here for years and they ruined this place when they raised their prices and took off half the menu. They used to have a bigger selection to choose from. If any of u had been to this place before you'd agree in giving it the star it deserves. There are other of plenty good sushi places to go to. Beware don't go here!!
Sushi wasn't great and....there was a roach crawling on my foot! Absolutely disgusting! I told the waiter about this and they did nothing! After this I just wanted out.
My favorite sushi spot EVER! Great food, quick service, & amazing staff!!! I don't live near by, but it sure is worth the drive. Well deserved 5 's!

For the $20 ayce dinner price, you really can't beat it! It was decent sushi. We would definitely come back. Staff was attentive and it beats the place down the road as far as quality is concerned. Bottom line is you get what you pay for.

I used to go here all the time before the owners changed. It was great! KEYWORD WAS! I've gone twice in the last month hoping that my laSt experience was just a mishap, I mean everyone has bad days. NO! I was here last night and the service is slower than ANY restaurant I've ever visited. We ordered all you can eat and it literally took them
25 minutes to bring out Just our edamame.  There were four other tables occupied and 2 servers. Absolutely no reason why it should take so long! The quality of the food has gone to shit lately & they've raised the prices! I don't mind paying more, but not when everything about this place has gotten worse! This used to be my favorite sushi place and now I'll never go back there. Pick somewhere different, if you want good sushi and a better experience.

We came in for dinner and ordered the deluxe AYCE.  The service was outstanding.  Ann, our server gave great suggestions and was spot on recommendations.  Jessica Albacore is the most amazing thing we have ever tasted.  Great job chef. The fish was all very fresh and tasted fabulous.  The place is small and cozy,  very clean.  We will definitely be back.  This will be our new sushi go to for sure!
Another sushi restaurant own by Korean. AYCES price is good. I guess that was the reason I wanted to try this place. Too much rice on rolls. Not enough choices.
Hours say they close at 10pm on Saturday. We just pulled up at 9:25pm and the staff was outside smoking, all the lights and open sign were off.

This place has gone down hill. 
New owners took over and seems like these kids aren't really sure what they are doing. One of the managers/owners was talking about business operations with us in the restaurant and being very rude. 
Up side is we weren't charged for having a few left over pieces, and the server let our son (2 1/2)  eat from our plates 
We will be finding a new sushi place to frequent though.
When paying for our $63 dinner with a $100 bill they frantically talked loudly back and fourth about not having enough money in the register to break it down for us. A guy needed to run to a near by business to get change.

If I could give this place a zero i would. First and foremost my wife and I along with our 5 year old came here to enjoy lunch right away as we entered the place the first thing we notice was out of the 4 open table 2 of them were dirty really dirty. We sat down because we were going to do the lunch special all you can eat and for my son to do the 9.99$ special which contained 5 cutt of california roll and 5 cutt of shu shi now becareful because they are chef choice they didnt explain that before hand. My kid got his food and with raw fish lol now i understand this is a shu shi bar but hes 5 the chef was cool enough and replaced the raw fish with another cutt of california roll. We order 3 dishes and it took an average of 30 for one dish at a time i get it one waitress for the whole restaurant but if yall a busy get help. The environment has changed alot since the last time we were here. The service here horrible and plainly put this place sucks go somewhere else and enjoy.

First of all, the service sucked.  There were only 3 tables of customers and we were in there an hour and a half.  No matter which ayce menu you order from, they limit you.  The waitress totally screwed up our orders.  A roll was forgotten.  The garlic edamame was gross.  They use garlic powder instead of fresh garlic.  They only serve mochi for dinner, not lunch and would not even make an exception even though they screwed up everything.  The value is not worth it.  Even though it is ayce you are limited with how many rolls you can order, what appetizers and desserts you can order.  I would never go back there.

Went to this spot for the first time because it was near my new place. This place was the worst "sushi" spot I've ever been too.First thing, the one server they had was a busy idiot. She runs around and gets very little done. She was more busy feeding herself in the back than the customers. I literally watched the sushi chef put up my food, and....it sat up there for 25 mins. I find that unprofessional/bullshit considering the fact that it's raw fish and you only have 1 hour time limit to eat....the "sushi chefs" here suck. You can tell by the presentation and the taste of the food. No respect for the product at all. 

When the food arrived it looked like left over sushi on a plate. Flavors were off...the color of the fish were completely off. You can tell they left the frozen fish under water too long because you can see the color bled out of the tuna. Texture of the assorted fish was slimy and flakey. The "eel" they put on my rolls taste like cardboard and looked like its been sitting around for a few days. Everything about this place is gross and not sanitary. Including those "chefs" that touch everything doesn't wash their hands or use gloves...

Every item literally took over 20 mins when the restaurant was empty. I asked the server lady " can I order more items?" She responded " u already ordered a lot of food so why don't you wait"... This is after sitting there for 45 mins with one roll....I found this disrespectful. This place is a joke. I will never return to this spot even if it was the last spot on earth that served fish. If you like getting food poisoning this is the spot for you. Stay away. Trust me. Sucks for them I happen to cook for a living too.

I heard great things about this place, but I don't understand what all the hype was about. Albertsons has better sushi, everything taste like imitation. At other sushi restaurants if you say you're going to do all you can eat then realize it is cheaper to just pay all a carte they don't make a huge deal about it. The waiter acted like we signed a contract to do all you can eat. I guess the bug crawling on the wall made me lose my appetite. Disgusting!!!!

Tasty rolls, fast efficient service. Only thing I did not like was when I tried to order a third order of salmon roe, they didn't want to give me anymore, so they said they were out of it.  No way they were out.  The price is $15.00 for ayce lunch, if they want to put limits on food they have touted as all you can eat they should do so, but don't lie to customers.  
All that said, the rolls I had, Hawaian, Island, Fire Dragon, and Hit and Run were all pretty tasty.  If you order any eel, you will get very small, very small amounts in the roll; however if you want eel, the best way is to order it as nigiri.  

Don't think we will go back again, as I really hate being mistreated by someone lying to me about what is available to have.  I prefer to pay just a little more and get decent service, quality and no penny pinching during service.

Average to below average place. Way too much rice. Quality of the fish is questionable. Lots of knots and hard spots in the fish. 

But, if you're into quantity of food over quality, good price for what you get. Waitress was nice but forgetful so had to ask for refills on drinks and items ordered. Won't go back - I'm a quality person but place was busy so obviously there are quantity people here.

So disappointing. Once you have great sushi and then you have salty sushi, it's not good. I've gone to Oyshi sushi on S. Rainbow and they are AMAZING!! The food here was salty, and gross. Don't spend the money, go to Oyshi!!

First time here... The setting is very nice but the music was way too loud.  However, I cannot say the same for the food. The cucumber salad was like eating shriveled up cucumbers. The Yakitori... Let's just say a waste of ink & paper on the menu. The sushi was not exciting at all. Service was way too slow. Probably my last time coming here.

I have always went there with my friend, we always drop serious cash and usually have a great time. I went there with my aunt for her first visit.  She knew I wanted the all you can eat sushi.  My aunt does not eat sushi mind you. I order then my aunt ordered the some chicken plate. I had ordered a salmon skin salad with my all you can eat sushi. My aunt just wanted to taste the salad. The woman immediately stormed over. The woman said you cannot share your sushi. I explained that my aunt does not eat sushi and just wanted to taste the salad. From that moment on the woman watched us like a hawk looking for prey. Her customer service was pronounced as if we were thieves trying to get to sushi plates for one. When she greeted the other customers she was happy. When she came over to our table the lady server had an attitude. I went to her and explain that I eat here all the time and she knew me, which she did. She acknowledged her big tip I always gave her. However, her service was rude very rude after that.  else . I work in customer service every day and believe me this was not customer service but a borderline of harassment . I wish I could leave no stars because you are not a star in my book.
My favorite all you can eat place in town! The staff and service are always good. Been here multiple times and am never let down.

I have to say I consider myself a sushi  connoisseur, especially here in Vegas.  I have been eating sushi for years, made it at home and know what's good and I definitely know when it's bad.  My husband and I came here years ago (it had a different owner then) and thought it was so-so.  We came back a few days ago to give it a second try and it was amazing!! The staff and chef was so great and the food was delicious!! I almost didn't want to leave. Lol.  We will most definitely be back. :)

WHAT A DISASTER THIS PLACE IS.

So, we heard from some friends that they had an awesome special at this place -- where until October 15th, they would be having $10.00 AYCE lunch and $15.00 AYCE dinner! All-you-can-eat is originally $19.99 for lunch and $26.99 for dinner... what a steal, right?

And then it all made sense. 

It's evident they probably offered this deal to get more people in the door to help business and their ratings, but seriously -- what a disaster. 

For one, there was an option on Yelp to make a reservation. I booked ours 3.5 hours in advance and even got an email confirmation. We arrived 15 minutes early, but the guy at the register said they don't take reservations. I showed him the yelp confirmation and the e-mail, but he just shrugged me off and said they don't honor reservations. Okay. 

STRIKE ONE? Wait. Give it a chance, we said...

We wait about 30 minutes and get seated. Can I just say I've never been so uncomfortably cold at a restaurant before in my life? It was 80 degrees outside at 8:00PM... and I had to go grab a sweater from my car to drape over myself because I was freezing. Very odd, but there were people wearing leather jackets and scarves... and believe me, we are not in winter weather yet. 

STRIKE TWO? It's okay, maybe it'll be worth it, we said...

To top it off though, there was literally only one server. ONE SERVER. A full restaurant, every table full... and you're running an AYCE special. But there's only one server? It's like this place is asking for bad reviews! It took 10 minutes to get our drink order in, another 10 minutes to get our drinks and to finally be able to order... 

STRIKE THREE? Should we leave? But it's so cheap, we said...

Then, because of how backed up they were, we were told that we could "ONLY ORDER 4 ITEMS AT A TIME TO KEEP AN EVEN FLOW TO EACH TABLE." I have never ever heard of this order limit before and I'd like to say I'm an AYCE connoisseur... This is strike four, right? We should get out of here, right?

I do want to acknowledge the young man who was literally sprinting around from table to table, trying his best to accommodate everyone. Your hustle did not go unnoticed and it's not fair you got put into that position to cover the WHOLE restaurant by yourself by management on a Saturday night when they were running a special. 

But 20 more minutes went by and we still had not gotten any of our food yet. At this point we were just hangry (hungry x angry) and not to mention ridiculously cold... we were just over the situation, and were ready to just drive to another AYCE spot and were more than happy to spend double paying 30$ per person than continue through this torture. 

Never again.. not even for half price.We had a great dinner elsewhere and agreed it was money well spent.

"What else can I get for you?" 
"How about the things I ordered ten minutes ago?" 
This is my visit in a nutshell. If you have hours to kill and want to be served by the most moronic staff to ever grace a restaurant, then go ahead.

I used to go here and it was good and fun atmosphere.  Went recently with my friend and it was awful! The staff were useless and we basically had to keep asking for the ONE item i ordered, even while sitting at the sushi bar. Terrible, wont get my money again.

My fiance  and our friend came here for dinner. Now, I remind you that we've been here before and I fell in love with it. Tonight's trip on the other hand wasn't so pleasant. Our server I'm sure is new. Very sweet. Only her and one other man on the floor. We put several rolls and it tool them more than 15 mins at one point. It's not busy either. The male server is an a$$. Also, the price went up. I might come back here or I might not. It depends on the rest of our dinner service. Hope this helpa!
The sushi here is tasty, fresh and bountiful. This is an excellent deal, especially when you go for the AYCE lunch or dinner. Tokyo Sushi House has become my 'go to' place for sushi!
Wonderful place to eat!  We really enjoyed Ann's service as she kept the whole fort down!   Thanks so much for a nice experience.

The sushi was good, the chef did a great job! 

With that said... I clicked the check in offer here on yelp for the free hot sake and the chef told his partner that my wife and I are yelpers and it never showed up! 

My water glass, although it was large was only filled once and sat next to me empty.

The empty dishes from the food we ordered sat piled up next to us the entire time. 

I guess I'm giving them 3 stars because the food was good and not 5 stars because the service was lousy

I'm not sure what has changed- but we won't be back for a while... Everything went downhill since our previous times dining here. We arrived as the only table- we figured we would be in and out. We put a roll in and our drinks thinking things would come quick. Tables started coming- and poof went our server. We waited 40 minutes for our first order which was ridiculous. I asked if there was only 1 sushi chef on- our server told us there is another that will hop on when it gets busy. WHAT?! We waited 40 minutes and we were the first ones there. And 2 other tables came it- not 10. They finally had the other chef hop on and everything came QUICK.

The quality was average. We used to love the rolls but they were mediocre at best. There was a hair in my roll, which is always disgusting. He promptly took it away and never brought us a fresh roll. He asked if we wanted the chef to make it again after we asked for the check. An obvious no, since we were ready to go. Nothing off the bill for the long wait or hair. We had a coupon, but it's the principle. 

Giving 2 stars only because it used to be SO GOOD and I have hopes it will get better. Make the drive and head to china town- Sushi Kaya or Doh Sushi are worth the drive.

This restaurant had the worst service I have received in a long time. We came for the AYCE, waited 45 mins and never got our beverages and one roll. We changed our order and left as soon as we could. I will never be coming back here again.

This place has great sushi and food and service. I took my family there for the all you can eat sushi. It's very family friendly. The food comes out really fast so you don't have to wait long if you have little ones or you're super hungry. 

We ordered green muscles which are amazing. (They take about 15 minutes to cook) so definitely order them when you get in. We also order the seared albacore which is also delicious and a few rolls. Everything on the menu is great. 

The staff is super friendly and accommodating. There is a sushi bar with sports on usually, booths and tables. Overall a great experience.

**Steve was our server and he was a rockstar! Thanks Steve!

This used to be our spot.  After tonight, I cannot say that any longer.  It's a Saturday night, we were expecting it to be so busy, with slow service. We were the only people in the restaurant the entire 1.5 hours we were there, and the service was worse than its ever been on a busy day.  
When I got my water, in a small plastic cup with what appeared to be a burn mark on the rim of the cup, I drank it all and waited a while before having to ask for a refill. I guess they were out of ice, because my refill was luke warm with no ice!
They raised their prices, which was a huge factor in why we chose that spot so often. 
The rolls didn't seem as fresh tonight as they usually are.  And 2 things we ordered off the menu, they ended up not having, so we couldn't get them- but we weren't told that for about 20-30min
And last, the waiter was so rude. He had no tolerance at all for my 18 month old who was quite vocal during our visit - who was hungry, and had no problems disguising his nasty looks to prove it.  Maybe if the food would've came at a decent time for the ammount of people in restaurant,  he could've began eating 30min prior.
You had a good run there for a while Tokyo Sushi house, but I won't be returning to find out of things ever get better.  We will follow or favorite sushi chef on to his next venture as we followed him to Tokyo Sushi house!

I really enjoyed it.  I got the all you can eat and drink.  As I was waiting for my friends to arrive, I took advantage of the all you can drink.  ;-)  Got a good buzz by the time my friends got there.  I let my friend order everything and it was all great except for some octopus, I could just not get it down my throat but everything else was amazing.  Will be stopping by again on my next visit to Vegas.

Spend time almost 2 hours here !! For lunch AYCE 19.99 $   Not busy . But food very very very slow. I  don't want you guys  very fast . But I think you should manage what food should come first . Everything very slow.So I have to cancel food. Because I can't spend time more than 2 hours .

Sushi rice  ( old )  Mussel very bad . Food bad today.

Service good .  2  Waitress they apologize about them business.  They are nice. 

This was the worst sushi experience I'd never had.

Hope your business will better .

Love this place! Love the specials for lunch and dinner Sunday through Thursday starting from $15 for lunch and $20 for dinner AYCE. No deluxe menu items but nonetheless you get dessert which is only ice cream but still a great deal.

Absolutely horrible! I did the AYCE and started off by ordering a hawaiin roll.. It had albacore on top.. the albacore was arleady pre sliced into sashimi and the sushi chef manicured the edges of the fish to make it look presentable, but the fish was obviously bad! Great service, terrible management. These poor dudes are constantly by themselves, every time I come someone or another called out. Not staffed the way they should be. Take a great place, and run it to the ground with this shit. I've been here for like an hour and a half waiting for my food

I drive so far to eat at Tokyo Sushi, it states online that they're opened til 9, I pulled up AT 8:00 PM, a whole hour before, and the sign on the door States 9pm as well. I pull the door, and it's locked, I look between the door crevice and there's workers in there. Nobody came to unlock, anything. Never coming here again. When you're hungry and want sushi during service hours, you can never count on Tokyo Sushi to be there for you.

I have to say this is the best sushi restaurant I've been to! Not only is the sushi excellent but the service is superb. Aytime we're celebrating a special occasion they always make sure they a save a table for us! Fantastic

awesome service, great sushi, and nice
vibes!! well priced also! our waitress was so sweet and knew the menu comfortably, able to give recommendations.

My gf and I went here 3 or 4 times between 1 and 2 years ago and  the quality has gone downhill along with the prices. I ordered sashimi and received nigiri. The rice is crunchy and packed on. The spicy tuna roll had seeds embedded in it with extra spicy red pepper. This was not as described on the menu. The lunch price was 4 or 5 dollars more than last time. We waited a while for drink refills. Do not come here for quality/fresh sushi.
My favorite all you can eat sushi place, by far! Inexpensive and delicious. Perfect location for me because it's close to my house! I'll be back again for all you can eat lunch very soon.

Sandwiched between a donut shop and a pizzeria is this nondescript-from-the-outside sushi spot, recently under new management and offering up a lot of bargains. 

PROS:
+ Half price special rolls from 3-5PM
+ Lunch price AYCE is $15 and goes until 4PM
+ Sit at the sushi bar and chat with the friendly staff
+ Creative rolls (including one with peanut butter!*) named after celebrities (such as the Salmon Hayek)
+ Dinner option includes a sashimi plate

CONS:
- Nigiri is cut uneven and ragged, not sure if this is due to knife skill or knife sharpness but they're not the thick, pretty cuts of fish I usually go for
- Rolls are super rice-heavy, you'll fill up fast... they also fall apart easily.
- Unclear whether half-rolls are available, was told I could get a half for my last one?
- Dessert mochi is literally a single mochi cut in half, kind of stingy. Not available for lunch.

Experience wasn't bad, I didn't have the poor service several other reviews mention. Unfortunately, I share Allen's opinion: I'm not going out of my way to return here, since there are better options closer to me.

*The Sticky Icky roll inclues peanut butter, shrimp tempura, coconut, and a few other ingredients and sounds absolutely revolting to me. Staff said it was more of a dessert roll and extremely rich, but when new management took over and removed it from the menu, people asked for it so much that they brought it back.

Just want to start by saying I wish I could give this place no stars but that's not an option. Can't review on the food because I didn't stay long enough to to try it but the service alone drove me out of here. When we walked in the only server working was on the phone. She came over took our drink order and returned to our table three times without drinks in hand. We ordered our food and the order was incorrect, we probably would have eaten it anyway but there were no plates or chopsticks on our table and our server paid no attention to us. We decided to just pay for what was served to us and go. Oddly our server asked us why we were leaving I had to laugh about it. Needless to say I would never return to this place and wouldn't recommend anyone to even try.

I will say this on the plus side they are right next to pokestop, so I was able to stock up while being annoyed.

This was my first time at this restaurant and it was a real disappointment. When we walked in, there was nobody to greet us.  After a couple of minutes, a guy sitting at a table turned his head towards us and told us we could set wherever we wanted. We sat down next to his table and his friends.  We waited at least another 10 minutes before our waitress greeted us for drinks while we watched the table next to us having a good time pounding hot sake. We waited another 3-5 minutes for our drinks while the guy who told us to sit stood by a booth staring at us.  Turns out, he worked there along with another person sitting at the table, and while we waited they sat and got drunk with their friends.  Our sushi took forever, most of the employees were drinking alcohol on the job while making sushi, they were eating while making sushi and one of the chefs was observed putting the sauce bottles up to his nose to determine the type of sauce.  This all occurred while the employees' table had round after round of sake and several sushi rolls while we are still waiting for our first order almost 20 minutes after we ordered it. The music kept getting turned up so loud I couldn't hear the person next to me talking. By the time we were done, half of the employees were drunk, we hadn't even received all of the orders we placed and to top it off, the waitress added 18% auto gratuity to our check and there was nothing posted anywhere about auto gratuity. It's an experience that will keep me from ever going there again.
John is the best server ever and they have the best rolls ever!! So glad we found this place!!!

No...just no. Granted we came on a busy afternoon, and I will give credit where credit is due, overall there was just so much wrong with this place.

The positive: The sushi chef was busting his butt to quickly fulfill the orders. There was constant hand washing by the sushi chef in between orders. The price of $15 for lunch was very appealing.

The negative: The quality of sushi was among the lowest I have experienced. Not only was it mostly rice (explains the low price tag), but the rolls were so sloppy and kept falling apart. My soy sauce dish was completely filled with residual rice. Also, everything tasted mushy and the same with an overpowering amount of cream cheese. We sampled 5 rolls between us and honestly I can't say any of them stood out or would warrant coming back even if everything else wasn't wrong with this place. The salmon was fresh, the rest of the fish was not. The tuna was the mushy glob kind that they just throw on top of the roll..instead of you know, using actual tuna. It goes without saying that the crab was the fake krab kind.

The service was non existent. I asked for a water refill twice, and never received it. The waitress was busy, but how hard is it to send someone from the kitchen to walk around with a jug of water and just refill the tables.Or she could have done it herself... it would have taken 3 minutes tops.  As I was leaving, someone actually got up with their empty glass and approached the kitchen area because they had been waiting for a refill during the entirety of their visit. 

The best part was the auto gratuity added by "accident"...$6 on a $30 order. When I looked at it and laughed she took it back and apologized for the "mistake". Right.... yes let me give you a 20% for doing absolutely nothing for me, not even refilling my water glass. So shady!

We tipped the sushi chef directly as he was busting his butt and actually serving us. I will not step foot in this place again.

Mediocre at best, menu was very shallow and not much to choose from.
much better all you can eat places in town. for better prices.

Went here for dinner. Didn't end up going with the all you can eat, but got some great vegetarian sushi. It was fairly fresh, and inexpensive. 

My only draw backs were the age dashi tofu soup - too salty. I was almost scared to ask the ingredients because it was kind of just thrown together and tasted like it was doused in salt.

The other thing is the service. Our waiter was nice.. but... we were taking our time. catching up with an old friend, sometimes you talk after you're done eating and our waiter just kept and kept at us. We were just trying to relax and enjoy our time! 

Overall, it wasn't bad, but I will probably never go there again.

5 Stars for the sushi, the 14.99 price for the month of October. 5 Stars for one of the best waitresses I've ever have had and I think she goes by Jazz!! She is worth the trip alone. Only bad thing I can say is for some reason the sushi chefs act kinda mean to her in front of customers. Maybe she doesn't eat sushi? Lol Grumpy sushi chefs are easy to find but 5 star waitresses only come around once in awhile. Thanks again Jazz for some amazing service and being so nice to us!!!

We love sushi so look for it when ever eating out. This sushi was great tasting and was a good deal to boot! The portions (slices) were small, but this is expected with all you can eat, and can be a good thing in these cases because you can then get more variety before filling up! They also have some good sides and appetizers that come on the all you can eat menu as well. I will say the hamachi kama was over cooked, but the salmon collar was wonderful and a treat you don't always find. I would have given them 5 stars for having good food, good variety, and good prices for the category of restaurant they are (not gourmet but good weeknight stop), except that the place smelled, felt, and was... grungy. A good thorough cleaning and fresh clean cloths to wipe the tables would have gone a long way to enhance the dinning experience and earn another star. The restroom (women's) was especially yucky. Really a 3 1/2 star because of this

This is my second visit to this sushi bar.  The people are very nice but the service is slow.  The issue is the food.  The sushi rice is under cooked and this is the second time this has occurred.  In addition, simple things like unagi was brought to my table burn't..  They do not seem to be serving the correct fish.  I ordered yellow tail and was given two pieces of a deep red fish.  I was told it was the yellow tail belly.  It was not!  This was a part of the fish that is typically discarded.  Do not let the price bring you here.  Your health is not worth the discount.

The food is great and they will alter a roll the way you like it. The price is excellent for good quality sushi and I am picky about sushi.  But the place has recently changed hands and the service is just a little slow. I'm hoping when they get a handle on things they'll get faster.

Great place! Customer service is awesome. Definitely a place I would visit again. Service was fast. Food presentation was excellent. Atmosphere was relaxing and very enjoyable. Food was very delicious and full of fresh flavor.
I love this place! They have good sushi for a great price. You can't beat 14.99 for AYCE lunch. The servers are nice and answer any questions you have. The place is a bit small though.

Okay, let me preface this by saying I've been a loyal customer for 8 years.  Last two times I've come, the service and wait times have been awful.  Didn't write a review because I really had hoped they'd turn it around.  They haven't.  Tonight it took over 2 hours to get two orders of all you can eat sushi filled.  They did last call 2 hours and 10 minutes before closing, sent two customers away at 7:50 pm when they don't close until 10pm.  They were out of eel sauce, avocado, cucumber, octopus and mango.  And that was at 615pm.  It's Saturday night, how in the heck are you out of so much at 615 pm???  Place is totally mismanaged, totally inept and not worth the time or money.  We were a party of 4 and would've rather left hungry then wait any longer for more food.  Tokyo sushi house, you've lost customers of 8 years tonight.  The fact you're out of so many necessary ingredients, I also suspect you'll be out of another thing very soon, business.
Read the reviews ! It's on point  ! Jus experience it !      Evening !Wednesday October 19 !

All I know is we waited at the front for over 10 min and were never seated. Seating is limited here but there were 3 empty tables that just needed to be bussed. After 5 min of standing around, one of the chefs yelled for a table to be bussed but it never happened. Not a single waiter or host made eye contact with us and since it doesn't feel great to stand at the front of a restaurant unacknowledged, we walked out. You have 1 job: customer service.

This was the worst dining experience I have ever had. We attended a birthday lunch, large party, reservations we're made. Although small, they were able to adequately accommodate us, seating everyone near each other. And that's where the good experience ended. 

It took 30 minutes for us to order drinks, another half hour before ordering appetizers and another half an hour before actually ordering our food. An hour and a half in and we hadn't had a single bite to eat. 

My appetizers never came, they ran out of tuna and their grill caught on fire so no teriyaki chicken. After half the party cancelled their orders and left, the waitress became annoyed and passive aggressive towards the rest of us. 

I watched 3 separate couples walk in, sit down and leave due to receiving no service. 

When I finally did get my sushi, it was delicious, but not worth the nearly 2 hour wait to eat it....

This location has the worst customer service I have ever experienced! From the time we were seated (the first customers in the door) it took 30 minutes to receive our first roll. The waiter was too busy doing things in the back to actually wait on the customers. We had to wait an additional 10 minutes for the waiter to come back to take our order for the all you can eat special. This is ridiculous!!

Food was awful and the wait staff were very rude. My waitress was Katie and she was very disrespectful so my husband and I did not tip her. So as we left she came outside cause my husband forgot his hat and keys. She then proceeded to beg for a tip. We then explained to her why she did not get a tip and she yelled at us telling us not to come back. Needless to say we well not be going back. One more thing the rice was cold and tasted like it was sitting out for awhile.

Unfortunately the price is the best thing here. I loveeee sushi and when I heard this place was $14.99 for lunch I had to check it out. Stopped here for lunch today with my sister and her friend. I did not like the server she was just blah. No personality at all. She barely said 2 words to us the whole time we were there. She never even said your welcome after we thanked her for bringing water or our food. To me that is just rude. Servers seem to forget their performance affects their tip... so if they act shitty they can expect the tip will be as well. 

So they don't have the best quality of fish but it is decent. We tried these rolls:
Cali in Vegas 
Hawaiian
Salmon lover 
Imperial 
Orange 
Sticky icky
Maui
Mexican which was never received 

Most of the rolls fell apart which is annoying. I don't want to have to use a fork while eating sushi ya feel me? And none of the rolls were great they were all just Ok. The ponzu sauce on the Hawaiian roll tasted like straight vinegar it was pretty bad. Also after reading the reviews today I found out they have dessert. It wasn't on the menu and you can bet our sparkling personality server didn't mention it. Never again.

Great food great service. The staff was very welcoming and helpful to our group of 7 hungry people! I enjoyed all the colorfully named special and the deluxe rolls. The Taylor swift was my favorite! I definitely plan on returning. It is a very cute sushi spot

I brought my genuine Japanese wife, made in Japan viladate quality:

All you can eat is a huge variety of options
Price is fantastic for the quality and variety. $17pp
Pretty rapid service for freshly made sushi

Two comments about other reviews less than 5 stars

Slow service? Its fresh sushi making. If you want fast service go to drive through mcdonalds.


And if you are so fancy that this food isnt good enough for you all you can eat sushi for $17 then go to Wynn Italian restaurant where they charge $35 for one single  shrimp. Yes they do. I personally went. 

Support this business. Its a hidden Vegas Gem.

Favorite sushi place due to great value.  Sushi is as good (or better) than higher end places.  Expansive menu.  Very accomodating.  Not giving 5 stars because there are times the service is very slow and every now and then the rolls aren't up to standards they usually have.
Worst service I have ever seen if I could rate them lower I would horrible. I've seen turtles move faster than the waiters

A good dining experience at a restaurant must have good food and good service. Tokyo Sushi House has alright food and lacks the good service part. My family and I went in with a 50% off coupon for the all you can eat for four people. The promotion had stopped so did they not accept it, which we were fine with, but the waitress did not have to have such a cold attitude towards us. From then on, the service was awful. We ordered appetizers and when they came out we ordered three rolls. Our rolls were brought out and from then we did not receive any service -not even refills on our drinks- until our plates were completely empty and stacked up ready to go. We would have ordered more rolls if we were approached sooner, but it was just not worth the wait. The food was okay, but the service was awful.

I've been here many times over the course of two years, three times in the past two weeks alone, this place was much better 8 or 9 months ago with the previous owners. I keep going back in hopes that I don't get the manager making my sushi I order. If anyone other than the manager makes your order, you'll be fine and they do quite well and the sushi tastes pretty good, but if the shorty Asian manager makes your sushi, he will load you up on the rice and gives you less of the raw fish. I go for the flavor of fresh raw fish, NOT to load up on rice.  I even specifically pointed this out to the waitress because I could see that once again the manager was making my hand rolls, I asked, PLEASE ask the manager to go light on the rice, last time there was just too much rice and I didn't enjoy it. So the waitress told the manager and guess what, he put even more rice. The hand rolls were like ice cream cones and 3 times the size of a normal hand roll. The manager in this place is just plain rude, the music volume is turned up way too loud and the manager likes to sing. This wouldn't be bad if the music wasn't from the 80's and the manager actually could sing, American Idol contender he is not. I waited 15 minutes while the manager sat at the Sushi bar talking to a customer that didn't want to talk to him, singing and then proceeded to watch TV, all I wanted was a bowl of miso soup and that took 15 minutes.  The owner of the restaurant really should make a surprise visit to check up on his manager, who only seemed interested in providing free sushi to the donut shop next door to get free donuts in return. This place use to be good, but the manager is ruining it for all locals.  I'm tired of giving this place my money, there are 3 other Sushi places within 2 miles of this location, I will go to one of them next time, I believe they are only $2 more in price for AYCE but it's worth it to not have to deal with an arrogant, music too loud, can't sing, watches TV, too much rice, ignores customers, no good walk the dog business manager.

Seen the ad for AYCE, came to check it out. Food isn't all that great. The rice was super hard! Not to mention the dessert, not as great! Waited for an appetizer for the longest l! Never again will I go there

Date of visit: Friday, 8/14/15.

OVERALL: The service started at 3 stars and ended at 1. The food itself was generally a solid 2-3 stars, a couple items were excellent and there were a few that were very poor.

FOOD: I found the menu offerings to be excellent in theory but average in execution, presentation, and flavor. The sushi was not well cut. Most of the rolls were very heavy in rice which was sticky in texture, but not enough to keep the rolls from falling apart. Tuna Carpaccio Sashimi - 4 stars. Jessica Albacore Roll - 4 stars. The miso soup was 2 stars, flavor was okay but it was lukewarm and one of the bowls had no seaweed in it. Edamame - 1 star, it was covered in salt a 1/2 inch thick, to the point where it clustered together and I needed to wipe it off. We ordered some other rolls and sashimi but nothing else stood out; everything else was average.

SERVICE:
Our server was Janelle, and while she smiled often and was friendly, she was not able to regularly check in with the table. She came to the table 4 times in almost 3 hours. We ran out of drinks with no refill. To be fair to her, which didn't help us, there are only 2 servers for the entire dining room. We arrived shortly after 8:00pm. I ordered a chicken teriyaki Bento box for my daughter, AYCE deluxe sushi  dinner for myself, and AYCE sushi dinner for my husband. My cousins and their friend had arrived a little earlier and we were seated next to them. Our dinner started as 2 orders of shrimp tempura, 2 orders of Miso soup, a Jessica Albacore roll, an order of Edamame, a Vegas roll, Tuna Carpaccio, and a Philadelphia roll. My daughter's bento box came out at about 8:45, along with all our Sushi rolls. I had to ask again for the Miso soup and shrimp tempura. The Miso soup was brought out another 10 minutes later, and instead of clearing the empty sushi plates from the table, the waitress set the soup half onto one of the platters and half on the table, so it tilted and soaked everything in its' path. Either she didn't notice or didn't care because she didn't clean it up, and our place mats and napkins got soaked. I asked again for the shrimp tempura and she said, "Let me check on that".  
Another 15 minutes later, I randomly grabbed the other server who was walking by and asked for the shrimp tempura. I finally got it at about 9:30, an hour and a half later. 

The restaurant closed at 10, and we were ready to go. My cousins and I got our checks at the same time, right at closing. As soon as they were given to us, we handed them our debit cards and set cash on the tables for the tip. At about 10:20, there is only my family left, and (1) couple seated at the bar. As we were staring at the servers and sushi chef clustered around the POS looking confused, I finally got frustrated and said loudly, "I don't know what's going on but I am getting frustrated!" The male server came up to us and said, I'm so sorry, we are having system issues. We will get you guys out of here soon. Another half hour goes by, and we are now the only patrons left in the restaurant, and he informs my cousin she'll see 2 charges for dinner on her card, and will this be okay because they made a mistake and had to re-charge it. At this point, I am beyond irritated, and tell the server, "the overall experience has been poor and this is not okay. We are being kept waiting for over an hour for you to figure out the register POS issues while the chef is releasing the kitchen workers and our waitress so as not to keep them on the clock. So his employees time is valuable enough that he doesn't want to pay them to stay any longer but our time isn't?! And I still haven't been given my card back." I ask the male server what type of experience he thinks they are providing and he says, "This is the service we are giving you right now". (Insert expletives I was thinking here!)

In my opinion, bare minimum would have been to apologize and offer a 10% discount for keeping us sitting there for over an hour past closing, or to wipe the dinner debt clean for not getting their register system together but an hour and a half after we gave them our cards, we finally got to leave - with my cousin having 2 charges on her card...

We came here because my cousin previously had a decent experience, and has an obsession with all things Taylor Swift, including the sushi roll they have named after her.

NEVER - EVER - EVER again.

Will never step foot in this poor attempt at a Sushi 'House'. Once was a family favorite is now bordering on a Sushi 'toilet'. Tokyo Sushi was the Birthday choice for my grandson. Starting with the single food server who was woefully inept at handling the entire floor by herself. 
Five waters and one green tea with no refills until the fourth request even though we could see full pitchers of water a short distance away. Orders taken for the AYCE sushi never arrived. Salmon Sushi was casually replaced because they were just out of salmon. Two of are party needed a fork, after 3 requests without resolution we went and asked for them at the bar area. Tables of guests were having the same frustration and cutting out early. Some of the AYCE sushi plates were brought to the table by our party otherwise they may have still been sitting there. 
A request was made to turn the TV from an episode of the Simpsons to a Sunday night NFL game to which we were told "THIS AIN'T A SPORTS BAR'.
Adjustments were made to the final bill. A learning experience for all parties involved. The owner should be aware that his hired employees ran a regular party of six out the door never to return.
Love this place great place to drink eat and have fun food is awesome people are great brings your friends they have all you can wat and Drink as well!!!!

This was the worst sushi restaurant I've been to. Their selection was limited. The price for dinner is a lot more expensive then other dinner AYCE. So not worth it. I couldn't eat anymore after 3 rolls. I was so disgusted. Especially with the "chefs" that were making the rolls. Blah!

This place used to have the best sushi I had ever had.... went in there 6 months ago after not going for a few weeks and it was horrible! Went back another time just to be sure. Their quality has gone downhill for some reason, the sushi is smaller now and more filled with rice. We stopped going here after being longtime customers for many years. They get 2 stars since their service was still great. We go to sushi bomb now.

No really nice way to put this but one of my worst AYCE sushi experience in Vegas. The minute sat down all the things that I enjoy and love about AYCE at my normal go to spots Tokyo Sushi House was none of the above. I meet friend with my roommate for not only AYCE but all you can drink add on for extra charge. One positive the all you can drink because not many AYCE around town that offer all drinking too. The beer they had was on draft (not remember the beer) was decent not low low end for all you can drink. They only had one serve for the whole restaurant that night. I might be harsh on the service being slow. But the reality is when there was only two other tables of two in the whole place, some people at the bar but they were done, and saw two sushi chefs. It making ZERO sense that our orders was coming out so slow. The part that really got me perplexed was all the speciality rolls was coming out faster then my nigiri. Both my friends only order speciality rolls. They would order two different ones each and my nigiri no where to be found. Hell I ordered couple side dishes and they came out in less then five minutes. Made no sense. The nigiri generally comes out the fastest. I was shocked they had no hamachi or scallop on the nigiri list. One list that was so small it was sad. Sushi all about quality of the fish first and best way get that is nigiri. The quality I feel was barely ok. Nothing fresh about anything I had that night especially the nigiri list. Some of the speciality rolls was creative with the names, some of the presentations was nice, and if more specialty rolls your thing they do offer great variety of options. Not for me. The side dishes were ok. Service was slow slow slow. One round the sushi chef brought out round apologize for taking long time. We were the only table in the place makes no sense service that slow plus not like getting quality worth waiting for in my mind. In the world of AYCE so many options in Vegas sorry but going stick with my go to spots.
It's $10 for all you can eat for the classic rolls, but here is what you get and the customer service is horrible.

I've been to this location a total of 4 Times.  The first 3 times they were just okay but the price was very reasonable so that's why I wanted to go bag to try their ayce special. The 4th time just helped me make of my mind to  never come back here again.  I'm not a big fan of fish. I enjoy yellowtail and that is about it.  The first 3 times I was living off of their Avocado and vegetable rolls.  The 4th time I ordered the same rolls, however the avocado was so minimal.  It seemed like each roll was just rice. The yellowtail was okay didn't taste super fresh, the only thing that stood out was their chicken skewers.  They did have a lot of flavor. Now onto the service.  The service was pretty non existent. it took over 35 minutes to receive 3 rolls. It took us over 25 minutes to receive edamame. The whole experience took over 2.5 hours and we ended up leaving hungry.  Our server was nice and apologetic  but that's time I am not able to have back. So I will definably not come back to this location and pay the extra 10 dollars and go to any other sushi restaurant in town.

I was just here yesterday with my brothers for AYCE dinner. We've been here before and just wanted the variety of special rolls they offer. I do not know what happened but this time around, it seems Winnie the Pooh was working in the kitchen. Almost EVERYTHING we ordered had freaking honey drizzled on it! The following is a complete list of things we ordered that was drizzled with lots of honey: Light and crunchy tofu, dynamite scallop, Imperial, Korean bbq roll (it was suppose to be eel sauce!), shrimp killer (with honey?! WTF!), Crazy philly, Jalapeno poppers. ALL with honey on them. At first my brothers though it was ok, but on ALL those items? we also ordered the baked mussels, the first round was ok, then the second time we ordered it, it had dynamite scallop sauce. WTH are they doing???! 

RIDICULOUS!

Worst Dining experience I've ever had. Went here today around 12:30 for the $10 lunch special and the place was obviously packed. My friends and I seated ourselves, (what pretty much everyone did), where we waited for almost 20 minutes for water and even longer for our food. They were so understaffed that a random lady was helping the 2 waiters hand out food-pretty sure she was a customer. The manager here is an idiot for offering a $10 all you can eat special and then only having 2 waiters on staff. I couldn't feel that bad for the waiters though as they didn't work with a sense of urgency that you should have when a place is that busy. The place itself was dirty and I was unimpressed with the food. Will NOT be back, especially with all the other great sushi places in Vegas.

WORST SUSHI PLACE I'VE EVER EATEN AT.

Please do not waste your time here. Theres way better places in Vegas that you can eat at. 

The waitresses first off had no personality. We would ask questions and she gave us a look like we were from a different planet. She understood english too so language was no a factor. When she finally did explain entrees, she spoke in circles and we were still left confused. 

Next, the prices are cheap but they have a very limited menu. Items that are not on the menu include moochie, or the screaming orgasm. Which in my opinion is one of the best dishes around. So, not only did we have to order the AYCE (which was 19.99 at 4pm) but then we had to order the moochie and the orgasm on the side. It ended up being 70 dollars for 2 people. Thats crazy! I would have rather eaten on the strip and had the excitement of drunk people or screaming tourists. 

What makes it even worse was that everything was flavorless. The sushi was okay, fresh but not top notch. The avocado inside wasn't ripe, that was the first thing I noticed. Next, when I ordered the shrimp tempera I found that the size was teeny tiny. I had to order multiple times since it only comes with two. I would expect 3 at least. Finally the next thing I was disappointed in was the green tea moochie. It tasted old and not as "green tee-y" as I like. The waitress messed up our order and then acted as if we never spoke to her. 

The only positives about this place was that the chocolate moochie was very fresh and tasty. The best dish I had was the creamy shrimp. It comes in two but i SWEAR it tasted like mexican flautas. All I needed was the sour cream. I had to order about 3 of them but i couldnt help myself. It was heaven. Lastly i ordered the fried cheesecake which was breath taking. Oh gosh, the ny cheesecake was delicious with the tempura batter on it. fan-freaking tastic. I sneaked and ordered another. I couldnt help myself. I know im bad, spank me. Don't worry, i worked it off later that night with our xbox kinect. 

Overall, save your money and  go somewhere better.
Update : im here again for $18 ayce and the food is much better this time. Nothing tastes burnt and the service is still top notch. I was served by chef steven and waiter paul. Will come again

Sushi was quite tasty. $30 for deluxe all you can eat. The sushi chef was very personable and made suggestions on what to try. Our favorite was the Taylor Swift roll. The tuna carpaccio was delicious. With the lunch price being $15, I'll definitely go back for lunch

Excellent service (our wonderful server was Ann), great presentation, and nice quality sushi.  I definitely will be coming back!  I wonder why it took me so long to try out this location seeing that it is so close to home, haha!

Came in at 745pm on a Saturday night and got seated right away. AYCE Sushi is usually not my thing, but after a trip to Yama Sushi last week in the U district, I decided I needed to find something just as good, but closer to home. The server greeted us right away and was ready with pen in hand. There are a few rules to AYCE and a 1 hour time limit is among them. No problem if you're prepared and have some idea about what you like.
We ordered a couple bowls of Miso and Edamame to start. Both were nicely done and hot. Then the food orgy began. We ordered an Orange Roll, (tempura shrimp with panko garlic crumbs & salmon on top with a mild sauce. I give it a 7.5), A Dragon Roll, (California with unagi, Great, a 10), A hot firecracker roll, not sure about the name, was next; consisting of spicy Tuna with jalepenos on top, (call that one an 8). Then came the orders of Nigri Sushi; Tuna, Yellowtail, Salmon, Tako, We ordered a few standard rolls as well. California, etc. All in all, we gorged ourselves in about 35 min. The freshness was a 10. Nothing tasted fishy or old. My 15 year old daughter & I put away a total of 6 rolls, & 11 orders of nigri, as well as the soup & edamame. The service was speedy, and other than running out of pickled ginger and wasabi twice, this place fills the bill for me. I'll be back to explore other rolls and creations. The fact that the sushi and rolls are not overdone with the rice, as is the case in some AYCE places, I am told, should be mentioned as well.

Overpriced with confusing explanation of the whole menu 
Waited for a while to get served and to get my check since it was one waiter running the whole floor 
Food was really good if you have patience and a fat wallet
Love this place! Best sushi place in Vegas. Amazing menu. Very friendly staff. Met the owner today and she was very friendly too.

I've been craving sushi all week, and my husband and I saw this place on our way to do some grocery shopping. We came in late afternoon, it was empty, we were seated quickly, the waitress was very friendly. 
 
My husband got AYCE, I ordered the imperal roll, and chicken teriyaki dinner for my son and I to share.
