I appreciated the non sex fused names for sushi rolls, my son is starting to read and those often bring up questions. My husband had banana roll,chicken teriyaki roll, shrimp tempura roll, and several others and had the cheesecake tempura for dessert .

It was really good, next time I'll go and have some saki martinis with dinner and go without the little man.  My son really enjoyed the fish wall paper :) 

Return factor: You bet! 

Cheyenne Strip, totally agree.

Save your money and go somewhere else. The rolls tasted like the ones you can buy at smiths or any other market. The nigiri sushi was also terrible and too dyed. The person who cut the fish did not know how to cut and would make the fish look stringy and dry. The service was also terrible. The only ONE waiter would just talk to the sushi chefs about their girlfriends and did not refill our drinks not even once.

Great service and terrific prices!  Even when extremely busy, they try to cater to all their customers.  There is a huge variety of rolls to choose from and if they can, they will adjust an item to fit the needs of those who have diet restrictions or allergies.

I adore this place. It's a little ways away from my home, but I don't mind the distance for good sushi at a really good price. Chill atmosphere, kind staff, delicious sushi. One of my favorite AYCE sushi joints. 

Now I'm hungry for sushi.

I have to admit that I've never had the AYCE sushi here, because it is not my favorite thing to do...but, I regularly enjoy takeout sashimi and it has always been fresh and tasty. Actually, I trust their quality so much, I just ask the for Chef's Choice of freshest fish when I call in my order. 

Friends who know I love sushi asked for a suggestion in this neck of the woods and loved the AYCE so much that they regularly drive from North LV to partake. Not sure about all of the bad reviews, because I've never had a bad piece of fish or service issue.  

Though it is infrequent for me to dine in, when I do, service is friendly and efficient. I've even been offered water in the summer heat while waiting for my to go order to come up. 

Is it the best sushi joint in town? No. But it solidly and consistently delivers fresh, tasty food, as ordered and I'll continue to choose them when I have a craving/am behaving/eating clean. 

Worth a try, for sure.

The best service and atmosphere of any sushi joint i have ever been too. The chef/s were great, fast and put out some great food. Staff was great and made me, my company and group (been there 3 times) feel more than welcome.
Best f****** sushi in Vegas hands down friendly staff great cooks sushi gets to you really fast I recommend this place to anyone

The first thing a person does when one comes to Las Vegas is enjoy the nightlife that is offered.  However, the setting can get a little too crazy after a day or two (well for me it does :P).  Tokyo Sushi House is a little bit off the strip and the vibe there is very chill, relaxing, and soothing.  A great escape from all the craziness Sin City has to offer at night and a place where we can talk about just what in the world happened last night.  I came here for dinner with my friends and it was perfect; exactly what we were looking for.  This is a great and fantastic place to eat at.  I've never had a problem, not even once.  The food is delicious and I enjoyed everything I ordered.  The very kind and polite staff greeted me and the quality service stayed that way throughout our entire meal.  Absolutely loved my time here and will definitely come back many more times when I visit Las Vegas.  It was awesome!!

This was not good sushi. The tempura was very soggy, just over battered, oily and soggy. Gross. I really didn't enjoy not one item I ordered. They work with Postmates so I had it delivered. It didn't pay to be lazy, I woke up with a stomach ache and everything :( no Bueno
Our waiter billy was just awesome always smiling an the Jenny roll was just mouth watering definitely coming back

We used to love this place. We would ONLY GO HERE for Sushi. My step daughter came into town over the weekend and we took her here last night to get her favorite "STICKY ICKY" roll that she has been craving. We sat down and got the news that EVERYTHING and i mean EVERYTHING has changed on the menu and they no longer have really anything on their old menu. No Sticky Icky. No Hello Kitty Roll. No Creamy Shrimp. NOTHING!! You cant even order it! The price is sill 19.99 which is fine but you literally have like 10 options for rolls. Hardly any appetizers. The service was TERRIBLE. We ordered multiple items that never even came. I am SO disappointed in this place now its not even funny. This very quickly went from our absolute favorite sushi place to one that I will never step foot in again. I am so upset that they literally took away all of their variety in rolls, got rid of the best sushi chef they had, got rid of all the amazing waitresses they had and now staffed with "PAUL" as the Chef and some random wait staff who literally never bring what you ordered. I literally am STILL pissed that I paid $80 for 3 people to eat literally 3 rolls because there is NOTHING ON THE FREAKING MENU!!!! Usually AYCE Sushi is a great deal, you get a great bang for you buck and feel like you ate your money worth when you leave. Not here, not any more. I felt cheated. I felt ripped off. I will never step foot in there again. Terrible menu. Terrible service. No options. No customer appreciation. REALLY YOU CANT KEEP A JAR OF PEANUT BUTTER IN THE BACK FOR ALL YOUR OG CUSTOMERS THAT ONLY EVER WENT THERE FOR THE STICKY ICKY ROLL???????? Congrats on your new restaurant, Paul. You just lost VERY LOYAL customers. Everyone knew how unhappy we were last night too and how often we used to come and no one gave 2 shits. Enjoy your mediocre sushi and limited menu - we definitely wont be coming back. What a freaking joke this place is now!!!

So... I was very skeptical when I came to this restaurant. But, hot damn! This place is awesome. The chef, Steve, is solo on a Saturday busy nite.... But he kicked ass! There not a single hiccup on the time we waited and the food was perfect. Our server, Jose, who was also flying solo... Rocked!!! Definitely coming back to this bombass sushi house. The service was amazing, always refilled our drinks and asked if we would like more to eat or drink. They welcomed everybody that walked in the door. I am pretty damn happy gal!!!
I like this place :-) the sushi isn't the best I ever had but the price $15 for AYCE (lunch) really makes up for that ;-) plus the workers actually remember their regulars! I love that :-)
My gf loves this place as it has cheap all you can eat sushi with good quality. Service was good and fast

One of our favorite sushi spots to visit as of late.  Great selection, friendly staff, and good food. The place is not huge, but low key in an odd location on Cheyenne going toward 215.  Check this place out if you're ever in the area and you won't be disappointed.

So much for the customer always being right.. so this is my experience from my visit back in December. At the time they were advertising some special on Facebook for $10 AYCE. We had been previously and enjoyed our meal with no issue. This time was a totally different experience. We went on a weekday.. there were several families in the restaurant including mine. The floors were filthy, they were sitting people at tables with disgusting floors. There was a toddler at another table in a high chair who's parents had poor control over their child. After the waiter left their table I kid you not he says to us, "God I want to stab that kid in the face" Seriously?!! You say that to another family who's also sitting with a child! The most unprofessional thing I've ever heard anyone say while they're at work. Thank god my kid wasn't acting up that day I wouldn't want anyone talking shit about her to another table!  So it comes time to pay and we're charged full price not the special price online.. my boyfriend gives me his wallet and he goes to put the baby in the car and when I question the waiter about the price him and another employee hover over me both rudely talking at the same time saying how the rules of the discount changed two days ago and because we didn't mention that we were doing the fb promo BEFORE we ordered that's what we need to pay. I couldn't get a word in. If it was a public ad online and they didn't hear us mention it when we sat down WHY wouldn't you bring it up to us?  I pay and leave. Later that evening my boyfriend calls to speak to a manager just to get the same rude attitude that we received earlier. This place is run by a bafoon that probably hired all of his buddies that couldn't get hired else where. Unprofessional, dirty, will con you for your money. Also on Facebook they advertise a menu of over 40 items, when you get there about half of them or more are sharpied out. Let me not forget about the quality of the food we could order was pretty average, nothing special... you could go to most sushi spots and pay $20 and get better AYCE. Anyway, I'll end with if that's how they care for their business and customers, I wonder how well they're taking care of things in the back and if everything is up to health code.

Most unprofessional restaurant I have ate in a VERY long time. Super slow service. I don't think this is a staff problem, but a management problem. For example: The server serving us jumped in the back and started making sushi after taking our orders? Doesn't make sense. Then as someone came in he started taking the orders again. Should  hire a sushi chef that specializes in that field.
No professional attire with the staff. Your sushi chef will make you sushi with his flannel on.
Waited 33 minutes for my first order of sushi to come out. Not worth the holiday discount. At all!
As for the sushi, it wasn't bad. I enjoyed it actually!

Super slow. Not professional. Horrible. Never again.
Not blaming staff. Just management.
Please Chef Gordon Ramsay, come save this Sushi House!

Every Worker was outside in the front smoking and one worker even said "oh you guys are our first costumers in three hours " if you're hungry for sushi and beer this is the place for you for if you want bad service (AYCE&Beer) but the service isn't that great and the food comes out really slow . The server has no clue what's on the menu every answer was ill ask my manger or sushi chef it was kinda annoying . 
I wouldn't come back because of the service and how far the location is from everything .
This place used to be my favorite sushi place, but now is really bad, I will not be coming back here!!! Service is slow and the sushi is terrible!!!

I've been here about 5 times and the food is always fresh and good. On my recent visit, some of the food was a little bit inconsistent. The fresh water eel was dry and the salmon nigiri was paper thin with tons of rice so it just tasted like I was eating rice. Besides that, everything else was tasty. My favorite is the vegas playboy roll and bomb.com. The service was very fast and our server Billy was very helpful and attentive. One warning though, DON'T GET THE STICKY ICKY ROLL. It's a shrimp tempura roll with peanut butter and coconut flakes and our group of 4, who all like peanut butter, all thought it was terrible. The combination of peanut butter and rice is so off putting. 

On another note, they are doing a promotion of $14.99 lunch AYCE till the new years but it doesn't stack with the restaurant,com gift certificate so keep that in mind. One other thing to keep in mind is that there is only 1 server and 2 sushi chef at all times. So service and food will be extremely slow if the restaurant is packed. About 6 months ago, I once ended up waiting over an hour just for 2 dishes to come out and my party was so pissed off that we left while still hungry because we just wanted to get out of there. 

Overall, decent and cheap food, great service(when it's not busy), and I will come back here often since it's so close to my house. I'll just avoid the sticky icky roll next time!
This place has the WORST service, whether they're busy or slow. The food is good, but every time I've been there, the service is somehow worse than before. Never coming back :)

Love this place! My Dad and sister went to this place and loved it so much they took me and I love it too. Their fish tastes really fresh, no weird fishy taste here. The salmon, yellowtail, and tuna were amazing!

This place used to be so great. Good food and fast, friendly service. Now it is under different ownership and it takes forever to receive your food and drink. I waited 25 mins just to receive one sushi roll. I knew something was wrong when I saw Chef Paul waiting tables and running register on a Thursday night. I think it is very unprofessional and in poor taste to see the owners come in and immediately get served meanwhile you have a restaurant full of paying customers who are waiting just to receive drinks alone as well as food. The menu used to be larger but has been cut in half and the quality of food has taken a turn for the negative. Please bring back the charm that made this restaurant great! I felt awful for the staff all they could do was apologize for the terrible experience we had. I probably won't go back.

Update: just went back and the only dissatisfaction I can express is that you can expect to wait about 20-30 for your sushi .

Just tried this sushi restaurant today. The atmosphere is really nice and the waitress who helped us was amazing. She remembered most of our orders from memory while handling multiple guests. It did take a while to receive our orders, but I didn't mind because it was well worth the wait. 

I recommend the tuna lovers roll and the lasagna. Their fish is super fresh. I really loved the tuna! I wish I lived on this side of town because I would probably eat here every day

This is unfortunate. We used to love coming to this sushi restaurant. The chefs were awesome, the sushi was excellent and the service was quick. To see this place fall apart before my eyes makes me sad. If I've ever seen a business pull a 180, it's this one. And not in a good way. To start, there are all new chefs.. Or should I say.. A single chef. The old ones left because they knew what was in their best interest. The sushi doesn't even taste the same. The last two times I've been here I've heard the employees discuss how one employee left the fish out and was serving it to customers. How is that legal? The service is SLOW. Previous reviews can testify. Customers sitting and waiting for 2 hours to not even be able to enjoy everything they hoped to order. And the best part? They opened another restaurant. How can you do that when you don't even have the staff to run the one you already have? Oh and they open at 11:30, not 11:00. Don't make the same mistake we did and show up 45 minutes early. I don't know why we even waited around. We shouldn't have given them the benefit of the doubt the last time we were here. We are gone, just like the sushi chefs, the sushi, and service that used to make this business thrive.
Horrible, I sat by the car for 15 minutes and then never open the restaurant when it said it was open at 11 am . Had music on , I check the door and nothing , bad management skills

Not a fan of the uninspired, emotionless staff here. After living in Japan for 4 years I thought maybe the "Tokyo" name attached to this place would provide a good experience. The Korean staff here were zombie like and the nigiri and rolls were average to me. Form your own opinion but for me this is nothing like a "Tokyo Sushi House"
Incredible AYCE Sushi house...  Chefs and servers are the best and extremely helpful...  10 Star!

Came here for the deal they have on a AYCE, which is a great deal. However, I'm really disappointed in their customer service. It seems they're short staffed. Only 1 waiter and it's a packed house. I had to wait 15-20 between orders or to even be acknowledged. The rolls were decent, not amazing. I definitely prefer other Sushi places more and wouldn't not choose this as my first option.
On another note, their playlist is amazing almost every time and the employees are kind when we do interact, but I'm not sure I'll be returning.

Ive been to this place twice. The first time I showed up at 1pm and it was closed due to the rice not being ready. The second time we showed up at 8pm on a Friday night and informed us it was closed cause they ran out of fish. What kind of management is running this joint?! I recommend Naka Sushi down the street for real consistency and excellent service.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. The service is the absolute WORST. Between being seated, ordering, eating, and paying, it was a 2 hour process. The food was absolutely repulsive and made me regurgitate in my mouth. The sushi chef (some tall white guy with tattoos) was annoying and arrogant the entire time. Seriously I've never been so upset with a restaurant before. Why does it take 45 minutes to get your check? Even when we asked for it 2 times. Don't ever come here. I will hope and pray this place gets shut down.

First time here very very good ,server Bill was amazing considering his first day chef Steve was bomb gave us samples that were off the chain I think I just found a new sushi home and till the end of October just 14.99 all u can it so glad I found this place ...thanks guys
Just tried the Maui roll... It was great! The waitresses spoke English which made ordering easy... No mis-understandings....just nice, quick and easy dinner!

Great sushi option right here.  All you can eat has a great selection of rolls and sides and apps.  Fish is fresh and the restaurant is clean.  We've come a few times near closing and they have always been friendly and welcoming.

Came here about 3 weeks ago  randomly, little did I know it would be my favorite sushi spot. I've had great experiences with the server Jose, who recommends the best rolls. The chef Travis was quick with our orders even though they were busy. Definitely worth a shot.

What happened? Since it's under new management the service and quality of food has gone way down. Very uncomfortable sitting down trying to enjoy a meal while the servers sit on the other side of you cursing and eating their non-restaurant food. I use to enjoy their Rock shrimp and now they cut three shrimps into fours and still charge you the full price for it.  What shame I won't suggest this place to anyone!

I didn't care for this place. They didn't really have anything spicey. And what we did order didn't taste very good. 

Pros is customer service was great. And they offer an all you can eat menu

Only scoring a 2 because I haven't gotten sick...yet.   Worst sushi experience ever.  Service is atrocious...1 person, waiting on 10 tables.  Running constantly.  1 hour after opening, they are out of tako, eel, calimari on the menu but they say they don't have it anymore.   Orders don't come out.  Have to beg for a refill of tea.

Definitely won't be back.

Gave them another chance since they have a new menu, which is decent. The service, on the other hand, is horrendous. We waited 45 minutes to get our first roll after ordering. They also allowed a table of about 15 people in the middle of the restaurant to carry on, extremely loudly yelling profanities, all the while families and couples were at other tables. The waitress claimed she was new, but gave us attitude when we questioned her giving our order to this large table. We endured this for two hours. Worst dinner of my life!

called and said they were not busy. got there. was packed. no clean table to even sit. seated in front seemed to be warm. ordered ice tea. no ice or sweetner. seemed to get hotter as we sat. ask to move to sushi bar only open clean space. they said it was reserved. didnt know they took reservations. ordered 4 tables still waiting. more people came in. no extra tables. finally and in closing so i wont dwell on this horrible place. wanted to leave because temperature and fear of getting food poisoning. charge for a warm ice teas no apology or for your inconvience tea on us. i will call channel 13 for dirty dining. yuk yuk yuk

If I could give negative stars I would. Came here on a Monday and experienced probably the worst AYCE sushi place I've ever had not only in Vegas but all my travels.  From quality of fish to service everything was so bad.  If you like throwing your money away, have hours to waste, or have no taste buds then this is the place for you.  I'd list everything wrong but I don't think I'm allowed that many characters to type on here.  Usually I'm the type of person if I have nothing nice to say then I don't say anything but I'm considering this as a public service announcement to save people from wasting their money and time.

We decided to try this place out because it was close to the house and they were running a deal via Facebook. After eating here I can understand why. The sushi quality isn't even grocery store level sushi. They had one server who was mediocre at best and inattentive. We ordered two rolls to start and had finished one before ever seeing another. We had to leave quickly because of a babysitter emergency and even tracking down the server to get the check was a hassle. There was a table that sat dirty for the entire time of our dinner, roughly an hour and the girl who came out eventually to bus tables was wearing sweat pants. Overall a complete disaster and I certainly won't be eating here again, so many better options in the area.

** Do not be afraid of the low price!**

For too long I was afraid of this place because the price seemed too good to be true.  I figured there's no way the fish will be any good.  Well, I am here to tell you I was wrong.

The business is clean and there is no fishy smell which can be found at some sushi bars.  The staff was very quick and attentive.  I also dug the decor. 

I enjoyed 4 rolls on this visit which include: Kiss of Fire, Fire Dragon, Spicy Yellowtail and a Spicy Salmon.  I recommend the specialty rolls, especially if you like your sushi spicy.

The fish was fresh and the flavors were excellent.  The Miso Soup was also very good.  You may say "well how can you screw up Miso Soup?" Trust me when I say that Sushi places do it all the time.

Best of all is the price.  I would normally give this place 4 stars because it isn't quite as good as some other places in town, but when you factor in the cheapest AYCE price in Vegas, it gets 5 stars!

If you are budget minded and can eat your weight in sushi, give this place a try!!

Love this place! Definitely not your traditional sushi. I have been here a few time now and still good. I like the atmosphere here for some reason. Usually good music and the people that work here are always nice and seem to enjoy being here. 

You will get better service sitting at the bar because usually they only seem to have one waitress working.

Sushi was good. Happy hour is worth it. Can't really judge the service, she was new. Still did good. The kitchen took foooooorever. 45 minutes to get a chicken teriyaki bowl. Restaurant wasn't busy at all. No excuse. Only one sushi chef working so the rolls took a long time to come out. 2 hour overall experience. Way to long. But like I said earlier, the sushi and rolls were good. Worth a 4th star if it didn't take so long.

Wonderful Sushi. There is a large variety of rolls and desserts. It's fairly priced at $17.99 for all you can eat lunch. The staff is very friendly and upbeat and the restaurant is extremely clean. Love this place!!!

My very first experience at Tokyo sushi house was nothing less than absolutely satisfying. The AYCE lunch special price is unbeatable for the delicious food, awesome atmosphere, and spectacular service! Paul took special care of us right at the sushi bar, even from the upcoming, unreleased menu and Maggie was on top of everything! Will definitely be frequenting this restaurant much more often!!

Misty charged us for an all you can eat, when we only had one plate.
Probably won't be returning.

Came here on a busy Friday night, but sushi chef Kris was able to keep up with our orders. We started off with the salmon sashimi with lemon on top, and if you haven't tried eating salmon this way I highly recommend it. They have quirky names for rolls like the "Jessica Albacore" roll and "Scallop Johanssen" roll. Everything came out tasting delicious, and I couldn't ask for a better ending than with the tempura cheesecake. Yup, you heard me! Tempura cheesecake. Order 2. You won't regret it.
One of the best sushi places in Las Vegas, the Maui Roll was AMAZING, awesome recommendation from Ann, our server who's also amazing. Check it out if you haven't yet, highly recommended.

I've been a few times but I won't be back.  Last night they were short-staffed, with one chef, in fact. A bad situation for sure but they could have handled it better than they did.  When we sat down, they could have told us that they were short-staffed and that there would be a long wait.  During the hour that we waited for the first food items to be brought to us, they could have thrown some seaweed salad on a plate, or made a few quick nigiri pieces, to hold us over.  It's sushi, so they could have made 1-2 orders per table at a time, giving everyone a trickle of food rather than most of us getting nothing.  During the second hour, more food came slowly but after 2 hours we still hadn't received everything we ordered.  The table next to us left after they waited 45 minutes for no food.  I had better experiences here in the past, and they did give us a 25% discount for our troubles without us asking, which was a nice gesture so I'll give 2 stars, but there are plenty of other AYCE places in Vegas.

This place has the worst customer service ever..  They take forever to take your order and then rush you out when your hour is over.. The owner or manager, who ever she is that just stands around and watches you like a hawk doesn't even help out at all.. There were only 3 tables being used and they told us to share 1 menu... hello?!?? There's no one here!! You can spare 2 menus right now I think you guys will be ok without that 1 menu... The sushi isn't even that good the only thing you guys got going for you is the cheap $15 lunch all you can eat price and even then if you pass that time while you are the the snotty owner/manager doesn't give it to you and gives you attitude about what time it is and gives you the dinner price... Bottom line is that place SUCKS no wonder why they are also dead... With crappy waitresses and management this place needs to be re evaluated and shut down!

This restaurant is located near I-215 and West Cheyenne. The ambiance is nice and small with a cozy feel. The sushi menu consists of classic rolls, bowls, tempura rolls etc. There is a lunch, dinner and deluxe all you can eat. With the deluxe it includes sake as well. It is well worth getting that as opposed to ordering on the menu.

We came here for the first time and had the deluxe all you can eat. We tried Vegas Playboy- flash fried tuna, salmon, yellowtail, albacore,& avocado roll served w/spicy mayo & eel sauce.
 J&B Special- soft shell crab, cucumber roll topped w/salmon, tuna, avocado, spicy eel sauce, tempura flakes, green onion & smelt eggs and also Hit & Run sushi rolls. They were fresh but I felt there were too much rice on the rolls.

The server, I think he is a owner or a co-owner who tends to us last night was very nice.

We're here for their $10 AYCE lunch special. We got here 11:30am, they literally just opened. There was a family on a table when we walked in, 1 server, 1 sushi chef. Later on there was a group of 4 people walked in, sat on the same table.
So, the server and chef tried their best to serve 3 tables. 

I heard the first family complained about the wait. Come on, maybe you should placed 2-3 items per person when you ordered and then placed more order when you were eating your last item like we did so there was no wait time, your food will keep coming.

All items we ordered were good, except unagi roll; they put tons of cucumber and very little eel so when we took a bite all we can taste was cucumber.

We had a good lunch. Each of us ended up with 4 rolls each.

Went to this place because they were having ayce sushi $10 for lunch $15 for dinner. You would think with this kind of deal they would be prepared for a busy day. Waited 45 mins for a table. Didn't get our order for another 15 mins and on top of that limited us to 4 rolls a table. Only one person was serving us but they still should have been prepared. Def not organized. And also if you're gonna have someone come out from the back and clean the tables, they need to look decent.  Not in some tights with their shirt too small and their belly hanging out. It was actually a little disgusting to see while we were eating. The rice was hard and the fish didn't seem at all fresh.

We have came here twice to eat.  Each time we have come there has been open tables and they have never been able to accommodate a Party of Five. It was my daughter's birthday and she wanted sushi for her birthday dinner the sushi bar was totally open and when we asked to sit there is it all we have two people coming.  My recommendation is to not go to this place at all it was dirty inside and the chefs all have facial hair and looked unclean.

Tried it because i got a coupon on Restaurant.com.  Service was very slow and inattentive.  Food quality was horrible.  Selection was lacking.   The worst sushi I've eaten in a long time.  Don't bother even with a coupon.
Wow such an amazing place, Great Vibes! The food was amazing especially the Trainwreck! Come in and see Dex, he will take care of you.

The food was alright. Wasn't too impressed. The cucumber roll wasn't all that great. The server was pretty terrible and didn't seem very happy to be there. He never filled up our empty cups but, what can you expect for all you can eat sushi for $10.
Paul is a great chef & manager, get the fire cracker it's awesome! My son loved their mochi and June our server was amazing. Great service and great sushi :D

First time to this restaurant and it was pretty good.  The moment I walked in, I was directed by the cook behind the counter to seat myself.  Since I was dining alone and the bar was full, I sat myself in a booth.  After about 5 min I was greeted by my server Thomas and he took my drink order.  I ordered a Coke but received a Dr. Pepper with a straw shorter than the glass.  After letting the server know, he promptly fixed it and returned with the right drink.

I decided to do their all you can eat sushi dinner and ordered 3 types of sushi:  The Salmon Lover, The Volcano, and the Rainbow Roll.  The Rainbow Roll was the first to arrive and it was an eight piece sushi dish.  Right when the dish was dropped off, I had to ask for the wasabi, the bowl for dipping, and the ginger.  He apologized and brought it right away.  In his defence, he was the only server on the floor (it's a small place) and it was almost full.  That being said, I understood because I too am in the industry so I acknowledge these types of things. 

The Rainbow Roll was my favourite.  The Salmon Lover was spicer than I expected but very delicious!  No wasabi needed for this dish.  Last to arrive was The Volcano.  This was a baked sushi dish (ok, that's new, but I'll try it).  I took two bites and said no thank you.  Just wasn't impressed with it.  Perhaps I was getting full, or the fact that I never had mushrooms on my sushi before.  Kind of throws the taste off a bit.  Last to arrive was my dessert of strawberry Mochi.  This was exactly how Mochi should taste!  Strong strawberry flavour, icy, and delicious.  I recommend trying it toasted.  Gives it a campfire marshmallow edge.  Not too bad!

Overall, my first experience was pretty good.  Thomas came back multiple times to check on me, offered me refills, and removed plates as necessary.  I felt bad for wasting the rest of The Volcano dish, but I wasn't sure what to expect with it.  

I will definitely come back in the future for more of that delicious Rainbow Roll...and try some new things too.  It also helps that this place is located 5 min from my house, which is a nice plus!  My four star review is specifically toward the food and not the service.  The 5 min greet time gave me a chance to thoroughly read the menu and make a choice.

To whoever took over Tokyo Sushi on Cheyenne and Hualapai... You ruined it... Just saw your new menu and it sucks!!!  All our favorite rolls are gone and I heard you're a bunch of jerks that took over Christmas week and fired everyone!!! Ewww!!! You just lost some serious loyal customers! Boo to you! #bringbacktherealtokyosushi

Great, fast service, which far surpassed Krazy Sushi's rather "don't care if you're here, don't care if you leave" attitude.  I quite like the fact ti's simply AYCE, which avoids the pages of rules posted everywhere as well.

PROS:  Fast service.  Not well known so not crowded.  $14.99 lunch, $19.99 dinner, $2 drinks.  They have green tea ice cream.  The waitress was very helpful in assisting one of our friends who has food allergies.

CONS:  Not a huge selection, and if you're a fan of crunch or yumyum sauce, or baked rolls, you're down to two or three choices only. They charge for mochi (FYI, you can buy an 8 pack for $3 at International grocery stores) separately.

I had the garlic tuna (fresh, very garlic-y), the Mortal Combat, and the Rock Your Body (a delightful mixture of sweet chili, an almost rice vinegar taste, and hot...it was unexpectedly good).  My friend had the Tiger (she was not fond of the nearly pureed spicy tuna on top's texture), and the teriyaki roll (it's a roll, but then they put full on teriyaki on top--as in they put the roll down, and then scoop chicken with cashews, carrots, and broccoli atop the roll....a bit odd but they liked it so much they had two).  

The rice was still hot on the first rolls giving them a bit of an odd sensation (never had warm sushi before) but it wasn't objectionable.

Bathrooms clean, floors clean, sushi counter clean.
Super fun atmosphere . Great food . Dex and the staff were wonderful and made great suggestions. We will be back for sure! Get the Jessica albacore roll.

The best quality, cheapest sushi you'll find in town. That being said be ready to wait a while for service as they usually inly have on server working. Although the wait time could be a little frustrating the management makes up for it with their kind and calm demeanor. I've found this place to be like a home away from home because everyone seems to know your name.

I'm not going to give out a full five star because of recent changes, but I still have to give a good rating because the service was still good and I have to give credit where credit is due.

First of, although the price stayed the same, T. Sushi House has made some pretty big changes. One of these is separating a Lunch, Dinner and Deluxe price. Now I understand why they did it, because price of food is getting higher and they have to adjust their prices to that. Lunch is still $14.95 and and dinner is still the same, but it's very limited now and if you want everything (like in the past), you'd have to pay the deluxe price. 

Second, the menu changed completely! Gone are my favorite rolls such as the Jenny, the Mortal Kombat, the Vegas and the Maui rolls and in comes the more regular rolls such as the dragon, the rainbow, the caterpillar and the lasagnas. I mean those rolls were there previously. However from a menu that consisted of at least 30 different rolls on just one side, there's only like 12 now. I was pretty disappointed with that. The big selection is the reason that we love going there. If they were to raise the prices and keep the same menus, there would have been no problem! Also, the appetizers were also lessened and they decided to keep some of the not so favorable ones (for us anyways)

Third, our favorite waitress no longer works there I think. The waitress there now is pretty nice, don't get me wrong, but the waitress before was just the "ish". She knew the moment we went in what we wanted and started on it right away.

Fourth, there's some changes with the sushi chef line up. The ones currently working now are decent, but it just does not taste the same. 

On the pro side, the service is still pretty good from the waiter and waitress. They're fast and efficient and they come to check on you every so often, which a lot of people might not like, but we do. They cater to everything you need and they're also one of the nicest. The rolls come out in a timely manner. However, my family and I are probably going to go to Naka for our sushi fix from now on since the menu doesn't agree with our taste pallet!

Best sushi bar I've been to in a very long time
They have amazing people that work there and I always feel welcome
The firecracker roll is to die for

Absolutely amazing!!! We love the food here.  The sushi is fresh. I can't say enough about how great the service was.  Our favorites were the Jessica albacore, garlic was yellow tail and tuna carpaccio. The AYCE was well worth it!! For dessert we have the tempura ice cream and tempura cheese cake. I could live off the cheesecake. If you are looking for a good sushi spot, this is the only place I would recommended.  Steve and Kris ware AWESOME!!! They made great recommendations and made the meal entertaining and delicious

Met up with a group of friends here & we ate ourselves silly!  Had a wonderful time, the food was excellent, fresh as well as beautiful, the beer was cold & service rocked!  What more could you ask for?

This place is "meh".  Not good not bad. Just meh.  First, they don't take the entertainment book coupon anymore so don't plan on trying it out that way.  Strike one.
Strike two: the servers were pushy. There were two and they both wanted to explain everything to us multiple times even after we told them we were fine. 
Strike three: the sushi all tasted like California rolls with different sauces (we actually ordered things quite different from one another). Not that the quality was bad. It was all just kinda ok. The spring rolls and potstickers were overcooked and they put sauce and the top so the crunchy got soggy. 
If you're in the Lone Mountain area craving sushi, go to Sushi Bomb.  It's two blocks away and much better. This place is a little cheaper though, to be fair.
This place is awesome if your a fatty like me. mortal kombat roll and sticky icky roll are delish! with only $15 lunch ayce it cant get as good as this place. give it a go!
Fresh yummy sushi!! I'm super picky when it comes to sushi and this place did not disappoint!
Great job, so many bad reviews but I really enjoyed the rolls & the price. $15 ayce for lunch! I'll definitely be back!

Been here before in the evening and it was okay. Came in today with a friend for lunch and the service was not so good. The waitress was the problem. She rambled on and on about every item we had chosen. I asked her which items you would recommend and she seemed impatient to explain them to me. I asked for the items on the pictures because it didn't have a description, she remembered only a few. At least she was honest to tell me she didn't know what it was but she should've asked the sushi chef. She critiqued everything after I had ordered. Because of her rambling and nonsense talking to the sushi chef about customers, she forgot their items when she got back to their table. I overheard everything behind us. I heard her say sorry several times to the table behind us and blamed it on "one of those days".  The people behind us left and she went to continue her  rambling of customers to the sushi chef. He wasn't so positive either and went along with her(waitress). She came back to our table and asked what we wanted next, forgetting the fact that we had already ordered. This went on several times during her shift and it wasn't even busy. She just would not stop talking to the sushi chef. The items on the menu was mediocre and nothing great. Rolls were cut unevenly and the menu was icky dirty. I get it, but try cleaning it for the next customer!! Also, if you paid extra for the "deluxe" items then you'll get something worth eating. I'm not coming back here. No wonder they only received 3 stars. Waste of money coming here.

They were out of a lot of stuff and quality just went down the drain after second order. The sushi was made with cold hard rice that tasted like supermarket sushi sitting on refrigerator shelf too long.

Did an all you can eat (AYCE) here a couple times.  The fish is fresh but not the best.  I had a bad taste from their Uni but that could have just been one day.   They're consistently good but I find myself using alcohol to get by during some of my meals.  

I went  during the night and it wasn't too busy but the sushi dishes came out so slow.  The staff is friendly but next time I think I'll try to sit closer to the fish because our sushi took a bit of time to come out.

One day I'll get my picture on that wall!
Just tried this gem for the first time. Awesome selections, cool atmosphere for such a small place, and very sweet and funny staff. Looking forward to going again soon.

If you like sushi this you need to go to Tokyo sushi 
And there customer service is great
Travis and Steven always make us feel at home !!!

I have been coming to Tokyo Sushi for awhile...always has great service and great AYCE sushi! We went today for lunch and the service was horrible. The chefs were using profanity and our waiter took our drink order then Dominos Pizza delivered a pasta bowl and we never saw our waiter again.  The chef came out and took our sushi order.  It took 20 minute  to get our order of nigiri and another 20 min to get our rolls...very disappointing! they have just lost another loyal customer along with friends and family!

My experience at Tokyo Sushi House was bittersweet. I gave it two tries and though I think the sushi is delicious, the service is very slow.

I came here a week ago because a fellow Yelper shared the December special-- AYCE sushi for $10 at lunch and $15 at dinner. What!? I had to try it. My office is about 15 minutes away so I decided to take a longer lunch to account for drive time and it took very little convincing for my best friend to join me. We met there at 12:10 PM. By 12:50, I had only received one of three rolls I ordered. I cancelled the second roll when I realized that I wouldn't have time to eat it and had them box up the third roll when it was finished. My bestie was lucky to get two rolls by 12:50 and then a third made quickly for us when we told our server we had to go soon. We left at 1:10 PM, definitely disappointed. The guys working there are nice, they are just overwhelmed. Though there were only four other tables dining with us, it was too much for only one sushi chef to handle. They need more staff for lunchtime.

BUT we thought the sushi was delicious. We especially enjoyed the Firecracker Roll which is large and tasty and the Blackjack Roll which had great flavors that paired well together. We also enjoyed the Mexican Roll which has a nice, not-too-spicy flavor, and a crunchy jalapeno slice on top. Yes, the rolls are heavy on rice but I don't really mind that when the flavor is on point and the fish tastes fresh. So I decided to come back once more last Sunday with my brother and his girlfriend. We came around 3 PM and to our dismay, there was only one sushi chef and one server again. Wait times were as long as my first visit. Though we could eat more, we ended up asking for the check early because a large party had been seated and we didn't want to wait another hour for food. However, we loved the sushi once again. The standout this time was the Tiger Roll.

TL;DR
I recommend this place if you're coming for the special and you have time to spare. It's definitely worth the wait for good AYCE sushi that's only $10. Though I was disappointed twice by the slow service, I definitely got my money's worth and enjoyed the food.

Best prices in town!! I love this place!! Great food and service just down the street from me! I'm spoiled! My fiance doesn't even like sushi it took me here just for me I thought everything was wonderful excellent service I will definitely come back!

Sorry.  I wanted to like it.  It was OK last time I went, but it's gone downhill fast.  Seems like they have trouble keeping employees.  Only one person  was working in the whole restaurant at lunchtime.  It's not  really great quality fish.  They were missing a lot of items on the menu.  Best wishes to whoever buys this place because I don't expect them to last long like it is now.   I feel bad for having to post a bad review, but it is what it is.

We eat here about twice a month. The sushi is always fresh and they have a great selection of specialty rolls.  Dex is a wonderful sushi chef with a great personality and is always happy to make my rolls with less rice then a normal roll.

Fresh fish, great price, relaxed atmosphere, friendly service....that's what I'm looking for in a local sushi place. Tokyo Sushi House always is on the mark. Stephen makes fantastic rolls. The Taylor Swift - with gyoza inside! Such a unique and delicious roll. It doesn't matter if I'm here for lunch or dinner, I'm always very full and happy when I leave.

We have been here 2 times now and we love this place. The servers are super nice and food is superb. They alway play some very cool 90s music. The sushi Chefs are very entertaining and come out to talk to you at the table. We love this place

This place was advertised for all you can eat promo going on from August 1st thru 7th. We decided to try it out. Awful experience!!! They sell all you can eat for $15 but you end up realizing that would've gotten more and better for less money... This place is designed to make a fool of you, rolls come in ridiculously small sizes and with tons of rice, time of wait for the next one is about half an hour, you get to choose from only one column of the menu and except for certain rolls. Even more!! All their soy sauce is only red one which is vey salty. It's like fucking designed to make you not wanna eat it so much!! Ok so way too much rice but now listen to this!!! If you return your plate with some rice left on it you get charged for it!!! WTF?!???! Seriously??? If I eat I get charged, if I don't eat I get charged, AND get forced to eat their stupid rice just so I feel full and don't want to order anymore. This his sick!! Never again!!! 
P.S. Also sounds weird to listen to country music in a sushi restaurant.

Where do I begin. Not only did the "waitress" not ask if my boyfriend, and I wanted anything to drink but she didn't even bring out any wasabi. The sushi chef kept talking to us and interrupting us, clearly he should be able to tell that we were not interested in sharing to much information about ourselves but he still kept going. Also there was a (BIG) guy making sushi who was completely rude. He pretty much told us to calm down on ordering because he didn't want to over charge us. As a customer, I have the right to order as much as I want considering were paying for it instead of rushing us to order. On top of that, I have to make it known that, the girl that was supposedly a waitress, had zero experience in what she was doing. She took our dirty plates, and never brought us new plates. She also made a rude comment about how frequently we were ordering shrimp tempura. IT'S ALL YOU CAN EAT. WHY DOES IT MATTER HOW MUCH OR WHAT I ORDER. TERRIBLE SERVICE. LET IT BE KNOW. What really ticked me off was, one of the chefs loudly asked if we were ready to call it a night. I eat sushi often throughout the month, and lets make it very clear. TOKYO SUSHI LACKS AS A BUSINESS.

The one thing you need in sushi is fully cooked rice,  so when you give under cooked rice you get one star in my opinion. Plus the service is slow the place was dead and it took an hour to serve we only a couple rolls. For a few bucks more just go to sushi bomb up the street

I am writing this from my table at the restaurant.  My wife and I have been here for over an hour and have only received three out of the seven rolls we've ordered.  While the food is tasty and has good presentation, the service is incredibly slow.  We haven't been given any refills... No side plates for soy sauce... No ginger... No wasabi... It's as though no one here understands how to operate an all you can eat sushi restaurant.  

Beyond that, the interior is in desperate need of a facelift and they could stand to employ more than one server at a time.  I get that it's a week night but seven out of ten tables are full of people.  The waiter is far too slow to balance this many customers by himself.

We won't be coming back.  That is, if we ever get out of here.  I'm still waiting for those four other rolls...

The place is under new management. Service is sooooo slow it's laughable. 25mins to get first item. Seems to be a younger staff employed that's not so quick. I will for sure be going elsewhere even though I live 2 blocks away.

Currently dining in the restaurant as I am writing this review. It's Thursday and there is only one server working the entire floor by himself. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted very poorly by a guy with his back to the door on the computer. Should have left as soon as I saw that mess. They do not even know which order goes to what table, we waited so long for the food to come out, and they didn't even come by to see if we needed anything else until.an hour into our "dining experience"
Obviously, the owners changed, the prices went up, and the menu and customer service sucks ass. 
Peace out Tokyo sushi house.
Very good sushi. We weren't sure when we walked in but Dex and steven pleasantly surprised us with some excellent played and great presentation. Highly recommended.

Rude, rude, rude. I've been in AND tried to order through Postmates. They cancelled 3 orders at different time of day, one being 3pm on a Wednesday, saying they were TOO busy.  Then I finally got to place an order, at 5:30 on a Friday, and they said it would be 1.5 hours. Okay great, let's try it. The delivery guy got there and they told him it would be another 20-30 mins. AFTER the 1.5 hours. He said they were incredibly rude to him. I didn't order anything hard, 2 basic rolls and edamame, so it's not like it's difficult. It's almost noon, opening time is 1130... doors locked. 5 cars waiting for them to open. 

This is ridiculous, you run a lunch special all over FB, yet are not even open?? Come on. 

6th car just showed up.

Extremely slow service! It took 1.5 hours to get two rounds of rolls for 3 people. This was my 2nd time there and it had not gotten better. Even with the holiday discount, it was not worth it! 

Dishes were dirty. Sushi was mediocre, with a few OK rolls and a few poor. 

Not one Japanese person working in the restaurant. The server looked like a meth head. He had some sort of melt down and the the sushi chef who could have been his older brother had to take over serving. Had to ask for water refills and left hungry because we didn't have more time to waste. 

We will not be back.
My friend and I love coming here for the awesome sushi! It's always consistently good and Kris and Paul make the experience even better!! Ask for the Taylor Swift roll!!!

Interior was nice there was a crack upholstery in one of the booths and they didnt cleaned it out there were crumbles of tempura evrywhere came here for the $10 all you can eat sushi and oh boy we had cream cheese overload we couldn't finish our sushi and because of that we ended up paying $20 more for left overs next time we'll try their soups. Vegas roll was the bomb.com

As others have said. This place is not worth the money.  Even at such a low price.  Let me list the pros and cons:

Pros: 
 Rolls are okay at best
 I didn't get sick.
Cheap

CONS:

 Place is packed and you have one server and one chef.  This is a management issue.  They are setting up the staff to fail. 
Staff is not professional.  The chef is okay.  He is a champ really.  Now the server looks like a tweeker I'm sorry to say.  He also kind of freaks out on himself.  It's not a comfortable experience.  
 Place is sticky and dirty.  Bathrooms are a mess. Not what you want your spot to look like when  eating  uncooked food.
 The menu is incredibly limited no sides, no sushi only a few  rolls with lots of rice, crab mixture, tempura shrimp and spicy tuna pretty much.  I ordered a rainbow roll and there was just a smear of fish on top same thing with avocado. 
 being that there's only a few people that service is incredibly slow.  I was limited to how many roles I could order for my daughters and I at a time, and some of them were even forgotten until at this point we needed to go.   In one hour and a half that got us two roles each and I eat sushi up very fast. 

Again I think the sushi chef is the brightest part of that place.  He is just incredibly limited by management or lack thereof to be honest.  If money is too little to  hire the correct amount of staff then start raising your prices again, we have been here many times and every single time it gets worse I no longer will be coming back I'd rather go to Smith's and just get sushi from that place.

Had a coupon for 50% off, although they also had great deals for all you can eat. My husband and I have been trying new restaurants  (to us) lately and I had the coupon, so we went. I like most sushi, but not all. I, however, loved everything we tried! Very good, but different flavor combinations that were awesome! We will definitely be back.

Very friendly, casual. We sat at the bar and were well taken care of. Our chef made us several legacy rolls since it was our first time here. He also made us a "9/10 hot roll" b/c he saw we liked it spicy! It was very hot! Made us feel special to get special rolls. Servers/bussers were slow but nice. Had to ask for personal plate with wasabi and ginger, which didn't feel very hospitable. I feel we received better service than the tables, so sit at the bar if you can. I think overall service was average for a place like this. Price was great and they really make you feel like a VIP.

We have been coming since before the owner change. We were upset at first at the change but have now come
To like it and found favorites and they have kept a few of the rolls/apps they used to have. Tonight we had a table of 5. For a Sunday  it was busy and obvious that they were under staffed. I will never hate on servers when a restaurant is clearly not staffed correctly has I have been there in that position. But at the bar I noticed two men at the end chowing down on sushi the whole time we were there and noticed they walked in the back several times so I knew they were the owners. Our poor server was so swamped that he couldn't keep waters full of keep up. Rather then the owners step in and help they say there and watched and did nothing. I wanted to grab the water pitcher and help. I loudly said way to go and help your staff when the men exited the restaurant and after they
Left it was a big relief on the staff. We will be back because we like the food but shame on the owners who could give two shits about their staff and the patrons of their establishment. Are 0 star reviews allowed? We had take out and it was a freaking rip off. For two chicken teriyaki's and a small cup of miso soup it was $24? WTF?! It tasted like a  frozen dinner. Stay away and warn your friends.

Went there for the special.  
1) half the menu isnt included in the special . including nigiri
