Get your shit straight tokyo house.   Get fresh fish and get rid of the special, your menu is very small to begin with

I love this AYCE place! 
This is the spot me and my sister go to when we are looking for great sushi at a pretty great price. I am almost afraid to say how great their price is in fear that they may change it. 

The rolls are always great! The side items are always amazing! (Please Note: For some reason... when you go one week then the other week, even thought the appetizers are the same, they are always made different... still good though)

I just can't say enough about this place. The price is great, food, and environment is just great!
Food was okay. Good service. I will go here if I'm in the area. I'm not going to go out of my way to eat here though. There are better sushi places closer to me.

I love this place! I'm lucky a friend introduced this sushi restaurant to me, I don't go to any other sushi restaurants anymore. The staff is always very nice and very helpful. They're rolls are creative and wonderful, my new favorite is the Light & Crunchy Tofu Roll. I highly recommend this place and will be back time and again.

Tokyo Sushi House is a decent, solid all-you-can-eat sushi place. It stands out for its creative, interesting rolls and competitive pricing - at $15 for lunch - so if you're more into modern-style sushi and/or a bargain sushi session, this is the place to go. The appetizer entrees are pretty good too. Everything else about the place is just about standard (or a bit less), but put it in perspective of the great AYCE value. 

Highlights were the unagi nigiri, and the Dragon and Volcano rolls. The rolls are creative and well-made, without excesses of sauce and seasoning; you can order half-rolls too, which let us try a lot of the menu! Definitely a good place for rolls. 

The unagi is particularly good if you prefer the sauce a little less sweet. Besides the unagi and hamachi, the rest of the nigiri was disappointing; the fish was so-so, and the rice was cloyingly dense. I prefer nigiri over rolls so that was unfortunate; if you require a variety of good nigiri, you may be disappointed, but it's also a matter of preference here, or maybe a bad day/selection.

The service was a bit lackluster, though sufficient. The waitress was spotty considering we were the only party for majority of our stay, and kept making awkward placements with the dishes. The chefs were better - attentive, and skilled, though difficult to engage with any depth. As a whole, staff interactions were pretty awkward, and I'm hesitant to visit on the same shift to have to go through that again. 

I will be back, though, to give the place a second chance on the misses, and to try more of the great, unique rolls on such a good bargain.

Went with the mom last night and It was amazing. Great food! We had the Maui roll, hello kitty, Cajun lover and a few more and they were all delicious. We also had lost of garlic tuna nigiri and the fried cheesecake. All awesome. Staff was Super nice and the prices are great as well. Also love the decor and upbeat popular music playing. Will be back again soon.

I just left this place SUPER-annoyed. I showed up by myself around 8:30pm on a Saturday night and  took a seat at the bar. The chef then tells me that they are not seating any more tables. As soon as the seated guests were done, they were closing early for the night. I asked what time they normally close and he let me know they closed at 10:00pm. 

Customer service in this situation was horrible. There wasn't much of an "I'm sorry about that" or anything. It was basically "We're closing early. Get out". So I did. And I won't be back to see if the food was actually any good. Lame.

I will never come back. Not because of the mediocre food and service, but because of the dishonesty. Also, everything is mushy.

I only decided to try Tokyo Sushi House because I got a 50% off coupon on a supermarket receipt. They were very sorry they had arbitrarily stopped accepting these coupons a couple weeks ago, but they had nothing else to offer than claiming they were victims of big bad supermarkets not stopping the coupon being printed. Expiration date is 2 months from now. Dessert to go? 10% off as a courtesy? Nothing. Ironic that a Japanese restaurant would have issues with honoring their promises.

The food was marginal. Solid C- to C across the board. The fish was okay, mostly on the bland side though. I've had better at most AYCE places I've been to, but it was better than the sushi offerings at Smith's. The Hawaiian roll was bland and mushy, but okay. The Vegas whatever roll was also bland and mushy, but okay. The sweet potatoes in the tempura vegetables were awesome, but the other veggies ranged from overcooked and mushy to having soggy crust from either too much moisture in the vegetable or too low a frying temperature. The eel sauce was imbalanced toward vinegar, and the tempura sauce was lacking in any sort of flavor. The rice in everything fell apart. This was especially true for the nigiri, which I guess is a good thing because it meant I could just have sashimi. Thankfully they didn't argue with the crumbled piles of rice that went back on those plates. The rolls barely held together. Other reviews have mentioned the wonder of what are now called "legacy rolls"...but the legacy rolls seemed more like a vehicle for getting rid of a too large cream cheese delivery, so I didn't order any.

The rock shrimp aioli was quite good. I tried my friend's. The texture was way different than I was expecting, but it was pleasantly reminiscent of dim sum (a little context goes a long way). Also quite good was the green tea ice cream. I've nearly gotten used to green tea ice cream that's more like frozen egg nog with green food dye. But this had a strong flavor and that slight bitterness that sweetened matcha has, and apart from a few icy bits was some of the better green tea ice cream i've had.

Service was worth a 15% tip. When asked if we wanted wasabi and ginger, my friend said yes, and i asked to have wasabi with no ginger. A small plate with both came out, and nothing else. It seemed to be shocking that I wanted my own wasabi with no ginger, despite asking for it. Very large water glasses meant I didn't have to ask for a refill, and it tasted neutral. I asked for lemon for my water, and despite there being a lemon floating at the bottom of the rock shrimp aioli that came from the same round of ordering, I never got a lemon wedge for my water. Other than that, service was just fine: friendly, attentive, but not cloying...about what you would expect here in town. 

I feel like the positive reviews have to be shills, people who have never had good sushi and really like cream cheese and sugar sauce, or have no teeth.

I'll be perfectly happy to stick to my proven favorites: Osaka (on Sahara), Yama, and Sushi Roku.
American style sushi, food is so so. The wait is horrible. Took over an hour for a simple chicken teriyaki meal. The restaurant literally had 10 other people  just waiting . Will never return again.

Worst sushi restaurant by far. They are out of every fish you want. They stated that they were out of salmon when I ordered nigiri. Then they serve a roll to the person next to me with salmon on it. Worst service by far. I ordered yellowtail, and waaaalaaa they are out of that too. They were out of almost every fish on their menu. Place is garbage!!!!! Sasa sushi is right down the road and far better service and quality.

Finally decided to re download the Yelp app (my phone needs the space for photos and videos haha) so I can make a specific review for this restaurant. 

I always love giving new chances to restaurants. I was a huge patron of the original establishment back in 2012 (this restaurant not the Craig one), I loved it at the time. But slowly it began getting worse. By 2013 I switched completely. I reluctantly call myself a sushi addict, so I go have sushi at a minimum of once a week. 

Last time I was here was about 10+ months ago. Basically few things have changed, and somehow, the only change that's been going on is it keeps getting worse. 

I've had the unfortunate opportunity to try out both places (hoping one would be better than the other, no luck). 

At the moment, I'm writing this review from my bathroom. A little more than 7 hours ago we are here, and I've been stuck going in and out of the restroom due to food poisoning from this restaurant (when I go out to eat sushi, I don't eat for the whole day, so this is the only explanation. PS I don't eat the whole day, so I get my money's worth come dinnertime.). This place charges $27 yet does not offer the typical dinner favorites that other AYCE sushi restaurants offer, sea urchin, sweet shrimp, salmon eggs, etc. I finally came around to downloading the Yelp app again (I need the space, 16gb iPhone struggle), considering the food poisoning. 

Like its other restaurant, the rice is either crunchy or undercooked, when you get the opportunity for that perfectly steamed Nigiri rice or sushi rice, it's a rare and exciting moment. Like their other restaurant, the sushi "chefs" are young, inexperienced, and often side tracked by using their phones or talking with their buddies in the back kitchen. This place did better than the other, it took about 20 mins for me to receive a roll (the other place it took 30 mins for me to receive a spicy tuna roll, and my date a rainbow roll). When I received the Super White tuna, it seemed like it had been sitting out to thaw from its previous frozen state. The slices were not at all cut properly, one piece would be a sliver of fish, while another piece would be a two biter. There are two trending issues, employees who don't care (aka sushi chefs who, I feel, are doing their job just to pay bills instead of for the love of cooking; coming from a previous Le Cordon Bleu student who loves the art of cooking) and understaffed restaurants. This place was not busy, much like it's other restaurant on Craig. Somehow, even though it was half empty, dinner here lasted for more than 2 hours (while at any other one of its competitors it would last about an hour for the same exact orders; Im a plain person, I get the same thing everywhere I go so it's easy to compare lol).  2 hours for a sushi dinner would be reserved for a gourmet restaurant like Nobu, NOT AYCE, and especially NOT Tokyo Sushi! 

Do yourself a favor and go to any other AYCE restaurants , just not this place (or it's Craig location, or any other future location it may have)! 

In case you got lost in my little rant, here's an easy overview:


The Good:

-Some great lemonade (although other restaurants have the same amazing lemonade)
-Nice decorations 
-Yummy SOUNDING rolls 

The Bad:
-Slow Service/inattentive chefs 
-Undercooked/crunchy rice 
-Kitchen workers who are allowed to join the sushi chefs (essentially, they learn how to make sushi and you're the "lucky" one who has to eat it, OR be charged for the roll) 
-Higher possibility of food poisoning (at the other location my date got food poisoning, and at this location I got food poisoning. There's always a risk when eating sushi, but the odds of us both getting sick? No so likely unless it's bad quality/sits out for too long)  
-Like the other restaurant, people wearing gloves while touching your food is a rare sight to see (strange considering it's an SNHD healthcode violation NOT to wear gloves)

Writing a review while I wait; been here for an hour now. I received my 1st order of nigiri after 30 minutes. Places a second order after 10 minutes after my last bite of nigiri. Waited another 10 minutes for my rolls. Then another 10 after my last bite for a bill. I came for AYCE and we were only allowed to request half rolls for our last order. I order half rolls and I received full rolls. 

Rolls were ok. Fish was not up to par. Looked as though they used long grain rice. 

During my entire visit, I received only one drink refill. The ice cubes in my iced green tea had little green particles frozen into them. My boyfriend tried to convince me that it was green tea mix. It looked like algae to me. 

Maybe I came on a bad day and they were short staffed. Either way, I did not have a good experience.
Great food and service. They played some fun regae music which we love. The garlic yellow jalepeno and salmon crisps were so yummy   Paul was amazing and we'll definitely come back.; )

I love sushi, and I often come here even though it's 20mins away from my house.
First, price is unbeatable. I never seen $19.99 for dinner at AYCE. Most restaurants charge between $24.99 to $26.99. So I always tip them like $6 that only makes full price at other AYCE restaurant.
Their quality of sushi isn't different from other AYCE sushi restaurants. The rolls are beautiful (especially Cherry Blossom) and so delicious. I love Mortal combat, Lasagna, Kiss of Fire and Volcano.
The service is also great. Strangely I only go there on busy nights. Servers keep running to follow up the orders. They always check back how my table is doing, apoligize for delay if any, and thank us. 
Some people who never been a server doesn't understand how crazy working at a restaurant is on a busy night. I see they're trying their best and I'm happy that they are respectful and responsible.
So far this is the number one restaurant for me.

I have never had such horrible customer service right from the beginning.   So bad, that I had to walk out after they brought out our waters.

The waitress does not want to be there at all, she doesn't try to hide the fact.  She's very rude and short, and rushes you to take your order and throws menus and drinks at you AND has major attitude if you ask her ANY QUESTION(S).

Apparently they have this 'all you can eat' special, but you have to finish within an hour and anything you leave on your plate you are charged for and its about $15 per person.... NONE OF THE APPEARS ANYWHERE ON THEIR MENU OR SIGNS.

Also, like in the previous comments for this place, the owners do watch you like a hawk as your eating, although I didn't eat, I could see them.

The sushi was good, chef was creative, but the service was anything but great. We are Yelpers and showed the chef our "free sake" coupon on Yelp and in turn he showed our server and never got it. I ordered edamame and baked mussels and they came 20 minutes later and the baked mussels were burnt. Our waters were only refilled when I asked and we were never asked (by our server) if we needed anything.

My husband and I came here for our anniversary and got the deluxe Ayce, it was absolutely amazing. it included all the sushi, appetizers, all you can drink sake and beer. The waitress brought us samples of a few appetizers which was perfect as you waited for all the sushi orders.

One of the best sushi places we have been too!
Great chefs, awesome rolls & pretty good prices :).
If your ever near it stop in I recomend the volcano roll!

Went in and was told it was going to be about 20 minutes. After waiting a half hour (probably a little longer) went back in and another waitress said they would have to wait for another table (again). And she didn't know how long it would take. 
We waited outside the entire time due to the tiny size of the place. 
Won't be back.

It's $15 dollars for all you can eat for a reason. You get what you pay for. Sushi was not well presented, the taste wasn't fresh at all, and the rice was hard. The sushi in general was the worst sushi ive had at an AYCE. I have added another star only because I could tell the waiter was a bit stressed but was trying his very best, which I appreciated.

Cheapest option nearby - good food, we've been back several times. When you compare it to the other AYCE sushi places nearby though, Tokyo definitely falls a little short. 

Their rolls don't have the finesse that other restaurants do, but they are good, and for $15 AYCE lunch or $20 AYCE dinner you can't beat the price. I wish they had mochi as a desert option though!

Despite the bad reviews I read, I went to try it with my stepdad, son, and nephew. We honestly all really enjoyed. The service was a little slow, but other than that, really impressed. Good quality, great price. Share their special price ad on Facebook for a lower AYCE special! :) paid $10/person for AYCE and enjoyed every bite. The manager came out personally to talk to us multiple times because we had gone there a day before and they were closed when they were supposed to be open. They also paid for two of us! Sweet right?! But very satisfied overall and will DEFINITELY be back! :)

4/5 stars.  I would say the Chicken Teriyaki Roll and the roll with Peanut Butter (I can't recall the name, it was on the top right of the menu) were AMAZING!  You can't beat the price for All you can eat... $20 for dinner, what!!??  Awesome, I know.

-Doug

Beware. If you order a lot they will start charging you double for your drinks. Sushi was so-so, nothing special. It's $15 AYCE so what do you expect. I was still nice and gave a $5 tip but never again. Go up the street to Sushi Bomb and pay the extra $5 for way better service and sushi.

Was very disappointed in the way the service was handled here. The staff were slow and couldn't keep up with the pace of a busy restaurant and forgot some orders me and my fiancé had requested. Owner of the restaurant was sitting around and talking instead of jumping in to help out the staff. Too much little side conversation going on. What also made me upset was that they didn't address right away which rolls were ayce for 15 bucks when I ended up ordering before they told me so me and my fiancé had to pay the regular price for dinner. I see why many of my fellow Yelp members didn't have such a good experience.

This place is right by my house. All you can eat sushi and drinks for$ 24.99. Great deal!! Sapporo and sake included. We had the Cali crunch, spider roll, fire cracker, salmon lovers, spicy edamame, tuna carpaccio and ahi poke crisps all for $56!!!! We will definately be back! There are new owners. We had a great time
Horrible horrible horrible!!!! It was my sons birthday ruined by the horrible service and rude people that work here! We have been coming here for years never again!! NEVER

Stopped in for dinner and thought the sushi tasted very cheap. Just like grocery store sushi. 
I would never go back.

Awesome sushi for an AYCE and if you go ask for "JUN" by far the best service we've had in this place.  fish is fresh, sauces are awesome and the portions are  excellent not a bunch of rice in your rolls like other AYCE's, you will not be disappointed.
So my husband and I came here for lunch and It was spectacular. Reasonable pricing and service was great.

Wow, very disappointed.... 

We did take-out and my friends ordered sushi while I ordered the salmon teriyaki. 
They could barely eat the sushi and complained while eating it that it was really bad. My salmon teriyaki had the smallest portions of rice and the salad was gross. I could barely eat it because it was so soggy and wilted. 

We won't be going back there and I suggest you don't bother trying it! We had to beg for some extra soy sauce and they only got a little smidge of wasabi. They are tight on portions and extras.

It is so sad because this is near my friends house and we wanted so badly for it to be good because it is so convenient! Perhaps it was an off night, but I won't eat there again.

Hopefully they will get there act together!

I'm in shock at the reviews I just read on this place.

I was invited to lunch yesterday and my friend had to cancel, so I went without him to the place on Cheyenne that I thought he was talking about near the 95. Turned out to have an awful experience there, which could contribute to how much I loved my lunch today. This one is on Cheyenne but it's by the 215 far from the 95. 

I'll give you this: my friend is a regular here and he knows the waitress who was so so very nice to us and accommodating. She brought him a roll and forgot to put no-cucumber for my buddy, she was willing to take it back, but it looked good so I just ate it while they made him another one without the cucumber.

The place was clean, the orders came super fast and My God Man $15??? How can you go wrong. It's the wrong end of town for me, but I'll drive back there again. The most important things about sushi for me are fish quality and cleanliness is a close second. Straight A's on both from me. The variety rocks as well. Preparation, presentation, etc... okay it's not Nobu I'll give you that, but it's also not $250 each to eat there. Taste wise it's on par with Kaizen where my bill is easily $50 per person.

Strangely enough the ala-carte that I had the day before cost me as much as the AYCE here. That place charges $28 for their AYCE and I wouldn't eat there again if they paid me.

So strange how we can have such different experiences at the same places. For what it's worth, you can't beat this place. Enjoy it while you can, after enough people find it, that price is going to have to go up. You can't buy that crap at the grocery store for less than $8 a roll now.

Pfff, now that I've talked about it I want to go back now, but I'm still full.
The service was competent. The food was decent. Not my favorite,  but not bad. Nothing that really stood out as great or terrible. Average sushi place
14.95 for AYCE lunch. Guaranteed to return. I love the banana roll.
I don't know why I came, I guess I just wanted to try it and got lured by the Facebook promo. Bottom line is it was a disaster, a waste of my time driving out here.

I was very pleasantly surprised by Tokyo Sushi House. Located in a strip mall, The atmosphere is bright yet very comfortable, clean and inviting. 

Service was equally pleasant, Steve took very good care of me especially knowing this was my first visit to the establishment.

Food was very decent, I went with the AYCE and was not disappointed at all. I had a combination of rolls and some tempura, all very nicely presented and brought out in more than timely fashion. My water glass was always full, and I wasn't in any way pressured to do anything but take my time and enjoy my meal. Looking forward to my next visit!

It's honestly the worst sushi spot I've been to here in Vegas. The special they run isn't worth it. The quality of fish is inedible. They make excuses about being out of almost half of the items on their menu. The service is even worse. There isn't enough wait staff to cover the restaurant. Even for the small size of restaurant. No one should go here unless they have no other choice. They even blocked me from their facebook page because I wrote this review so I am posting it on here

Used to frequent this spot since it's so close to home and the sushi chefs were fun and very good at making rolls. Everyone always made us feel so welcomed. Was sad there was an entire employee change when I came to visit today, but I kept an open mind and sat at the bar like I usually do. Server was kind and good with water. Got my usual but were soo far from what they usually tasted like. No sauce, wrong sauce, no garnish, rolls made poorly, cuts uneven, tempura batter way too thick, and rice was poorly seasoned. I get it you're new and you won't know how to execute the rolls properly. However, a dirty station is unappealing, come on wipe your bottles, they are in view. Organize the fish display, the salmon and other fish were just thrown in with plastic wrap all messy. I get vulgar kitchen talk, but keep that BOH.

Came here after a horrible experience at the other location on Craig. It was like night and day. Way better experience at Cheyenne location totally worth driving the extra 15 minutes. 
Great and fun atmosphere! Rolls come out quickly and are very tasty. They were short handed with just one server on hand during Saturday lunch but besides that it was great.
Come when opens because by 1:00 it was standing room waiting

It is a mystery to me why these guys don't have a near 5 star rating.  I had avoided them for quite some time due to their yelp rating until a co-worker told me otherwise.  Their fish is fresh and service is fast & friendly, which is the absolute most important criteria for evaluating a ayce sushi joint.  And then the next most important attribute is price.  They offer $15 lunch and $20 dinner, both ayce.  Seriously??  I don't know how they do it because all of the competition that dips into that price range doesn't even come close to the same level of freshness.  

They have a nice variety of rolls, but sashimi is not included in ayce.  The variety helps because my man is allergic to shellfish/shrimp and some places offer up to 85% of their rolls with shrimp as the main ingredient.  An added bonus is their iced green tea, which is fricking amazeballs, but it's an extra $3 that's not included in the meal price.  

The sushi chefs are super friendly and johnny on the spot to whip up any custom creation that strikes your fancy.  

They close at 9 pm, which is surprisingly early for a sushi joint, so plan to get there a little earlier.

I have been going for over three years and the price and the food continues to be great. The service is fast and their selection is plenty. 

All you can eat for under 20$ and a great selection of sake!! :)

Highly recommend!!!

Not the best place and has a very small sellection of rolls that I enjoy, which once ordered are only so so. So of it's the only place a round I might stop and only get sushi peices. So it's ok if there isn't anything else around, otherwise not worth it.

Relatively new all-you-can-eat sushi place (they do a la carte as well) up in the Lone Mountain area.  I've been here about half-a-dozen times and always found the fish to be fresh and of good quality, and the staff to be friendly!  Sushi chef always manages to recommend something new that turns out to be good.  

Overall, it's comparable to places like Sushi Mon or Oyshi, except it's closer to my house.  Yay!

Not sure what's going on, stopped by 4 times already and they are never open, I'm here on a Wednesday night 5:25pm seeing 2 little kids sitting at the bar playing on iPad but door locked, I guess no more attempt for me I'm done and will never come back. It's just a waste of my time since it's never open.

If I'm going for cheap good sushi. I'm going here. To Tokyo Sushi. The sushi taste great and their all you can eat is totally worth it. $15 dollars for lunch! It's a steal. Not to mention is 5 minutes from my house. Everything accounted...It's a great place for good cheap sushi. The staff members are all really nice and it's also really nicer that they always keep refilling your drink. Especially when you're eating their spicy dishes.

I just ate here for the first time and really enjoyed it! The AYCE is totally worth it if you're going to have more than two rolls. The food was delicious and our rolls came in a decent amount of time for how busy they were. The staff was very kind and attentive.
Billy was our server and everything came out on time and it tasted delicious!! We will definitely be back soon! This has become our favorite sushi spot in town!

I have read the poor reviews and find that they do not come close to our experience here. We went at lunch and for 14.99 per person we had 12 rolls. Each one was excellent.  The fish was fresh and the sushi flavorful.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The rolls were creative, my favorite was the Rattlesnake Roll and the Sunrise but everything was tasty.  I do think from reading the reviews a lot of people expect too much.  Don't complain if something is not on the AYCE menu that you like at other places.  For $14.99/19.99 you aren't going to get the same menu you get at a $27.99 place.  Read the menu before ordering to avoid the problem.

The location is a hole in the wall but until I find something better, this will keep us fat and happy.

You get what you pay for I guess. It took about 50 minutes to get my first order. Only one waiter and every table is full. I'm here now waiting on my 2nd roll and I've been here over an hour and a half. The fish is ok. The $15 AYCE deal is a great price. The staff is friendly.
This place has gone completely down hill. Horrible service. Horrible food, and often out of a lot of items. Will never return.

I was on vacation in Vegas and I have some friends that live in the area and were in the mood for sushi, so we found ourselves here on a saturday night. I loved the fact that they have an all you can eat option :) you don't find it too often here (chicago)  well at least I don't. The fish was sooooo fresh and tasty OMG!! I loved every bite I took. The problem is that maybe they bit off a lil more then they can chew here. They had 1 sushi chef and 1 waitress while the place was full. At our table alone we would order 4 or 5 plates at a time. We ran out of water without a refill for at least 30 mins. I'm thinking they need at LEAST 2 people doing each job on a busy night because that was some awful customer service going on, but I'm giving them 4 stars because the fish was on point.

This is actually my second time eating here at this AYCE Sushi place, and I'm not going to lie... They have really improved! The first time I went was last year, & I was extremely disappointed. They didn't have dessert on their menu, they didn't do half rolls, and the fish wasn't fresh AT ALL. The old place would've been a -3 stars!

It's under new management now, so I decided to give this place another chance especially since lunch on Monday through Thursday is $14.99! Fish quality was definitely way better than the previous visit. I tried their garlic salmon & was blown away at how delicious it was! The fish melted in my mouth (which is a really good indicator for me). What I do have to complain about is how much rice there is on the nigiri. You don't need a shit load of rice on it, guys... So that was the only thing that caught me off guard.

The rolls are delicious! You MUST try Scallop Johansson Roll especially if you're a big fan of eel sauce, haha! The rice on the rolls were actually really sticky too. You want your rice to be sticky, but not toooooooo sticky - which were the case here. But other than that, it was definitely YUMMY compared to last time!

I'm definitely going to be coming back here often, especially since the AYCE is $14.99 on weekdays! :)

My wife and I have been here previously. The food was just ok then, no big deal. We returned last night due to a deal being run through FB. We decided to forgo the FB and just do deluxe AYCE. 

The food has greatly improved! The tuna carpaccio was one of the best orders of sashimi I've had. I was extremely impressed with the quality of the sushi. 

Now the bad part, even with the rolls being smaller than most sushi restaurants I've been to, it took forever to get our orders. We would get one roll served to us and have to wait 15-20 min for another roll. Our last order took 30 min for two rolls to be served! Unacceptable. One waitress and two chefs for a full house on a Friday night is horrible planning. 

We may try again because the food was so good, but if we received service like this again, we would definitely not come back. 

Right now, I can't recommend to anyone. There's too many four star sushi restaurants all over the valley to come here for a bad experience.

I cant believe the reviews Im reading here. We went here for the first time the other night and it was excellent. I work in the food service industry and can be picky at times but I have NOT a single complaint. My overall experience was 5 stars. The sushi was fresh and the rolls were EXCELLENT. I suggest anyone wanting to try this place to go. Not to mention $14.99 for lunch and $19.99 for dinner. WINNING all the way. Just go and see for yourself.

I don't even know where to begin...first off there was no server so I sat  myself down, then I start ordering and the server kept telling me they where out of stuff, I try to order ikura which every sushi place has he asked me what it was ..they don't have it , natto  don't have it , octopus don't have it .... ok ... well I try to order sake never got it if I could I would give 0 stars , busy or not still took more than 25 minutes to get 1 roll  then I got half of the sushi that I ordered the food quality is ok nothing great , the server was busy, 19.99 for lunch is alot for  ayce I'm shocked that they are still open, it's not the workers fault but I blame the manager or lack of  / owner .

If I could give zero stars I would...I used to frequent this place often. Food and service used to be excellent..up until management changed. New management is terrible, service...terrible, food mediocre.  Not worth your time or money. I had an issue with my food. Placed an appetizer order...never came out, placed my meal order it was wrong. When. I asked for the issue to be fixed I was ignored. The waiter kept apologize and saying he way new....i don't give a flying fuck if your new get it together and give some good customer service. Smh never coming back here again.

It's very obvious that the Tokyo Sushi House has turned their act around in the past six months or so; the older reviews do not do this place justice because IMO this place is off the chain.  From the outside, it's a very unsuspecting that some of the best rolls I've ever had in Las Vegas are only a door away.  Very inventive chef and the prices are perfect.  I've had sushi everywhere in town but this always the first sushi joint that comes to mind when I have the itch.  Service can be a bit spotty in the dining area so make sure you sit at the sushi bar - it's an idyllic experience.
Awesome sushi and excellent customer service will definitely be back again!!!!  Very great price as well.

My husband and I went for dinner and both got the ayce sushi. There were so many different choices of sushi, and a couple sides that weren't. My husband, who wasn't big on sushi before now actually likes it. The service was super friendly and the food was great. It was a good experience. We will definitely be back

We decided to try to try the special they were having. The $15 dollar AYCE but found out its ONLY limited to traditional rolls. So we decided to just go for the dinner instead. We didn't have a proper greeting, which is something you get to use when going to eat sushi. Setting was nicer than last time I've came here. Took awhile for our appetizers and nigiri to come out. Like 20 minutes. There was about 2 other groups with 2 people in it so I didn't expect it to take that long. More people came in and there was only 1 server. She was kinda slow and not so attentive. We finally got our seaweed salad and ate. We also ordered calamari tempura which took about 30 minutes, that was ridiculous, wouldn't call it calamari since there was barely a coat of tempura batter on it. came out all salty but the sauce helped us eat it. Then waited another 15 for only 1 roll. Still waiting on that nigiri we ordered. The rice was kinda dry and hard. Once we got the nigiri the rice was already falling apart. The fish was okay...for the price I expected better. In total we ordered 6 rolls and it took almost 1hr an 45 minutes. My boyfriend and I were getting irritated. We weren't the only table waiting for a while. And they were here before us. Not once did the waitress said sorry or anything. I know how hard it is but still. Food was alright. I could of gotten something better for the same price with better service else where. We weren't given a goodbye and come see us again. So I guess we're not coming back again.

LOVED this place

We enjoyed a valentines dinner with my three children and mother.. The staff was friendly, accurate and knowledgeable about their menu.

The food was better than expected and far better than our "normal" sushi spot.

Their music selection was unique and provided a inviting feel for hip-hop listeners!!

Decent sushi. I've been here twice; the first time the waitress was good. The second time, the waiter was slow, but nice. Took us a while to get his attention for simple things like water refills. The best thing about this place is the price; $14.99 for lunch AYCE, $19.99 for dinner. The menu is barely limited at all if you do AYCE - only one item isn't on either, and only 5 or 6 are only on dinner. Overall, not my best sushi experience.

First time checking out this location. Small little restaurant, like a hole in the wall type of place. We were greeted upon entering. Very friendly waitress who  happened to be the only one attending everyone. Ordered our drinks and ordered off the AYCE menu. Their menu is very small compared to the other locations I've been too. I can honestly say it was a hit or miss with the sushi we ordered. Not to mention we had to wait for our orders constantly. Some of the rolls did not look appealing or they literally fell apart. Needless to say it didn't look fresh. Although they were very courteous, they weren't on top of customer service or attentiveness. I am willing to give this location a second try, possibly and hoping they can change my mind next time.

I have been coming here fir years and i must say the new management is doing a fabulous job.  The sushi is fresh and the AYCE is well worth it.  

If you ask for Billy, he is fantastic.  Very nice young man and very attentive.  He is new to the area.  Make him welcome!  He will treat you right!

If you have  been to the Geisha Houses or the Todais of the world you could easily spend $50-$60 per person, this place is definitely my favorite so far. Prompt and courteous service, delicious food and the $15 all you can eat menu, the best!
Chef  "Alex"(his american name lol) is a delight.  I absolutely recommend this place for your sushi cravings. We will definitely be back.

This was the worst sushi experience I'd never had.
Only one server this lunch and I had the bad idea to go there with my all family...
It took 2 hours and we even don't eat what we was looking for.
Good deal for them, they suggest you a unlimited meal but they take so mint time to serve you each time that you surrender after 2 hours....
I will never go back!!!!

We went to this place for the AYCE... I had a horrible experience. We were the only ones there for the first 30 mins and they weren't very attentive. It wasn't until they got another customer that they filled our drinks and they charged us for one of sushi rolls because we didn't like it. The waiter said that we left to much of the roll. Even though everything else we order was gone. The rolls were fresh, I would just say make sure you know what you want because they definitely don't care if you don't like the roll...


Honestly, the food was THE only thing that saved this review.

I dont like to hit these guys with a one since Its been three hours and Im not ill like my last 1 rating but after asking for feedback it was agreed that was what they earned tonight. Here is why:

Im not a Sushi expert by any means but I do enjoy eating it and learning about new Sushi dishes. So when the GF and her daughter suggested it I agreed so we came here.

Upon sitting down we were greeted right away by the whole staff but that is where things went horribly wrong.

The server brought out our chop sticks and mixing bowls and we found a hair and some rice stuck to one dish.  I would normally walk out here but this is their favorite place so we stuck around. (No discount was offered for this but a very fast sorry about that was received)

We tried about 10 dishes and we were all disappointed that the rolls were all rice and filler with just the smallest hints of seafood. The fish wasn't the freshest but the flavor was good. 

There was three people in our group and two other tables with one server and two chef's We each ordered a roll and they all came out separately. Since it was all you can eat and family style I can appreciate that but when the other two tables were being served new dishes before ours came out it seemed liked a very disorganized restaurant 

When a set of rolls came out prepared different than how it was listed they explained it was a new chef and they would make us a new roll. Not wanting to waste anything we said thats ok.(this was another pluss for them)

Unfortunately the best part of the meal was the toilet in the mens bathroom. If you remember the Ferguson from the TV show "married with children" this is without a doubt based on that; for the business those toilets must see they must have some serious power just remember to stand before you flush or you may get sucked in. Its a serious vaawhooosh!!! And Al Bundy would be proud.

I've been here a few times, so this 3.5 gets rounded up. This is a nice little sushi place up on Cheyenne and 215 so it can be a bit of a drive if you're not in the area, but it's worth it. The decor is fairly plain, but it's always spotless. This is one of the bars where I say sitting at the bar is worth it because the chefs actually interact and joke with you, unlike some places in town. They give suggestions and actually help you have a well rounded experience and make it more fun. The fish to rice ratio more than fair. The fish isn't top of the line but it's about on par with most AYCE. The price is also good, being under 20 for lunch and they even had a special where it was $15 for a little bit. 
The only complaint I really hold against this place is that the service is slow. Like it takes forever to get anything, from rolls to drinks. I thought maybe it was just a busy thing but I've been there when it was super dead and nothing changed, so there's that. It's definitely a place I'll be returning to :)
Wanted to try a new place for sushi. Many things that we ordered never came out, seems like they were forgot about. Staff was nice but not great service.

I won't go back to this restaurant. Been here well over 45 minutes and still haven't received my order. It's not even busy in here! Very very slow moving staff. Unbearably slow and I am in the service industry. And the food was definitely not worth the wait! Much better sushi here in town. Don't waste your time.

Like I suspected, the low ratings of this place was due to how typical and bitter the locals in this particular area are. 

I refer to this area of NW Vegas as the "Cheyenne Strip".  The "Cheyenne Strip" starts at the intersection of Cheyenne and Durango, and ends at the 215. The yelpers who live in this area are the harshest in the world.  If they liked a restaurant-the food was good,-but it wasn't their favorite, they will go ahead and give the restaurant a 1-star. If they really liked the restaurant and it's their top 10 favorite restaurant in Vegas, they will give it about 2 stars. They have no real structure on giving out 5-star ratings and will just randomly give out a rare 5-star if they are in a really good mood. That's why when you click on their yelp profiles, they have like 20-30 1-star ratings and like one or three 5-Star ratings. Also, check the reviews for every business located on the "Cheyenne Strip". Every business on this part of Cheyenne has an average of a 2 star overall rating. Are these ratings justified? Absolutely not! The residents in this area are those certain types of customers that are very difficult and impossible to satisfy. 

The Sushi here is not bad at all. And the prices are the best in town. Where else in Las Vegas can you get a $15.00 AYCE sushi deal? For some reason, TOKYO SUSHI HOUSE reminded me of one of these places but without the conveyer belt.  

There are two Sushi houses in this area. The first being "Sushi Bomb" and the 2nd being TOKYO SUSHI HOUSE. A lot of people in the NW area compare this place to "Sushi bomb" and I think that's why many reviews are too critical. I actually decided to come here because "Sushi Bomb" gets extremely crowded during dinner hours, and like a lot of yelpers complain about, the wait time to get seated over there gets extremely long some nights. Sure, this place isn't a popular hangout for young people and pro-poker players like "Sushi Bomb" is, but at least it's half the price, you get seated immediately, and you get good tasting fish. Today, I was not in the mood for maki and wanted some good nigri. TSH, has a perfect selection of all nigri. They got everything from Albacore to Unagi, and the sushi chef sends it out fast. Also, the fish here at TSH is good-fresh seafood. There is nothing wrong with it like many NW yelpers claim. Many people try to compare the freshness to "Sushi Bomb" who actually kills some of  the fish the same day they serve it, but that's why that place is over $30.00 per person, and this place is only $15.00.  

If you follow my reviews, you already know that I am very critical of how uncultured  people are who live in NW Las Vegas. Before I came here, I already knew that a lot of the bad reviews about "rude service" was just their cultural ignorance. The servers here don't have much English, and have difficulties understanding someone who is speaking really fast. So, she is not "stupid" or "being rude" if she gives you an incorrect answer to your question. BTW, the service to me was very good. There was never a moment that lasted more than a minute where my drink wasn't being refilled. 

I guess another plus about this place is that the Sushi Chef is very quiet and traditional. If you have mature older family members or young children, this place might be the best choice. At "Sushi bomb", some of the chefs are young and quite popular with the ladies, so you might hear him bragging about how he banged some chick the other night. In conclusion, TOKYO is definitely has a better atmosphere for families with young children.

Most of the Sushi houses on the West Coast were originally established by Japanese nationals(not Japanese-Americans), and quickly sold to Korean-Americans. I don't understand why they always do this? Is this some kind of common investment by business men in Japan? I tried asking my Dad, my lawyer, and one of my best friends who are all Japanese-American, but because they were all born in Hawaii, they had no clue about why investors in Japan do this. Anyone know?

So practically, I would say this is a good 4-star establishment, but I will give it 5-stars just to compensate for all the unjust 1-star ratings

Very disappointed by our experience. We come here often, but the past 3-4 times we've been here it's slowly gone down hill. In the past they had a $15 AYCE, then they bumped it to $17, now it's $20 per person. Don't get me wrong, I'm willing to pay for sushi if it's worth it but this my friends is not worth it. We sat down and ordered our drinks, and quickly placed out sushi order (we've been here so many times that we have a go to list of what we like to order). The sushi overall took a VERY long time to get to our table. When our rolls finally did come out we weren't even given plates, soy sauce dishes or chopsticks- the sushi chef dropped off the rolls and walked away without a word. The rolls themselves were very disappointing. The rice was tough, not cooked enough. The rolls were cut very unevenly, I know what you're thinking- it's the taste that matters most but it was just a mess of a plate, 1/4 inch pieces, 1 inch pieces, 1 1/2 pieces. I watched one of the cooks as he refilled the crab meat for rolls with his bare hands, scooping and touching all the crab. I saw the sushi chefs with their sushi making gloves on touching the phone, the order sheets, cash register then go back to making sushi.... Why not just drop my piece of salmon in the floor why don't ya. There was one waitress, who was nice, but was maybe having an off day?? She was very slow, we had to track her down anytime we needed anything: more water, more rolls etc. The other tables went untouched after someone left, the dirty dishes just sitting there. We saw a group of people come in, sit down, wait to order drinks, order drinks, wait, wait, waited some more, and just left. This place has gone down hill. 
Tokyo Sushi- please get it together, we used to love coming here.
Best all you can sushi in town, hands down. High quality food and affordable price. Will always come here over and over again!. Family friendly!
